* The method can be used for installing glass panels in other vehicle windows or similar applications.
* The invention is intended to be taken as illustrative only and not limiting of the scope of the present invention.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to methods and apparatus for removing a gas from a liquid, particularly oxygen from water in an offshore hydrocarbon recovery platform.
* The invention provides an apparatus for removing a gas from a liquid, including a vessel for receiving a flow of liquid having a first gas contained therein, and mechanisms for ingesting and mixing a second gas into the liquid for creating a turbulent area and displacing the first gas to an upper portion of the vessel.
</summary>

• The present disclosure relates to a packaging machine comprising a plurality of work stations which are operable in succession in the production direction of the packaging machine, said work stations including at least one movable tool member.

• The packaging machine is provided with a rotationally driven shaft arranged in the production direction of the packaging machine, and each of the movable tool members of the various work stations has provided between them at least one transfer mechanism for converting the rotational movement of the shaft into the movement required to operate the respective tool member.

• The transfer mechanism comprises an arrangement of toggle levers and/or a cam mechanism for converting the movement of the shaft into the movement of the respective tool member, and the shaft is driven in a continuous 360° rotation.

<summary>
• The invention relates to finishing articles and more particularly to such articles having a mounting hub permanently affixed thereto for attachment to a rotatable power tool.
• The prior art discloses various devices for providing a disposable finishing article assembly, but these devices have inherent disadvantages such as adding additional labor and cost to manufacturing, requiring parts to be keyed together, and not providing additional clamping force during rotation.
• The present invention provides a finishing article having a drive member non-removably affixed thereto for mounting on a rotatable spindle of a power tool.
• The drive member includes a backing flange with gripping means radially extending therefrom secured by a retaining nut positioned on the opposite side from the backing flange.
• The retaining nut extends through an opening in the finishing article from the face toward the back and has a radial flange at one end thereof seated against the finishing article face and protrusion means extending outwardly from the other end thereof for non-removably securing the retaining nut and the backing flange together on the finishing article without the use of adhesives.
• A pressure cap defining a central opening is held in place by the gripping means on the backing flange and extends longitudinally away from the backing flange to engage the power tool spindle seat for placing the abrasive finishing article in compression during use thereof when the finishing article is operatively secured upon the spindle of the power tool.
• The invention provides a disposable finishing article assembly that eliminates the need for adhesives, provides additional clamping force during rotation, and simplifies manufacturing.
• The invention also provides a mounting hub that is permanently affixed to the finishing article, eliminating the need for separate adhesives or other fasteners, and providing a more compact and lightweight assembly.
• The invention further provides a pressure cap that is held in place by the gripping means on the backing flange and extends longitudinally away from the backing flange to engage the power tool spindle seat for placing the abrasive finishing article in compression during use thereof.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a hydraulic unit for a vehicle brake system.
• The unit includes a housing block, a motor, and a covering hood.
• The motor is located above an eccentric chamber, and a conduit leads downward from the eccentric chamber to a central venting point.
• The central venting point has a check valve that allows pressure fluid to flow out of the unit.
• The unit also includes at least one reservoir for temporarily storing pressure fluid.
• The reservoir is connected to the eccentric chamber and receives pressure fluid dripped from the piston of the pump.
• The pressure fluid is collected in the reservoir and stored there until it is needed.
• The invention offers the advantage of cost savings and improved safety due to the use of a single conduit for the pressure fluid.
• The housing block can be immersed in saltwater without damage.
• The invention provides a practical exemplary embodiment for containers with favorable production conditions.
• The invention brings about pressure equilibrium between the motor and the covering hood.
• The invention can be used in a variety of applications, including automatic braking and traction control.
• The invention is suitable for use in a vehicle brake system.
• The invention provides a hydraulic unit that is easy to produce and maintain.
• The invention offers improved safety and reliability due to the use of a check valve.
• The invention provides a hydraulic unit that is compact and lightweight.
• The invention is suitable for use in a variety of industries, including automotive, aerospace, and industrial manufacturing.
• The invention offers improved performance and efficiency due to the use of a single conduit.
• The invention provides a hydraulic unit that is durable and long-lasting.
• The invention offers improved safety and reliability due to the use of a reservoir for storing pressure fluid.
• The invention provides a hydraulic unit that is easy to maintain and repair.
• The invention offers improved performance and efficiency due to the use of a check valve.
• The invention provides a hydraulic unit that is compact and lightweight.
• The invention

<summary>

* The invention relates to a power and free conveyor system with a carrier that is moved along predetermined paths by engagement with conveyors.
* The system includes a third dog that is provided in longitudinally spaced relation to the first and second dogs and is normally urged to an operative carrier pushing position but is held by the track out of operative position.
* As the carrier moves to a transfer zone, one or the other of the second and third dogs is successively moved to operative position.
* The third dog is used to transfer selectively across a greater or shorter distance, accommodating various systems wherein the transfer varies between short and long distances.
* The invention also provides for minimum cost and maintenance, and selective transfer of the carrier can be achieved over short and long distances as desired.
* The cam projection on the second dog extends oppositely to the cam projection on the third dog, allowing for successful transfer across different distances.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a grounding product for railroad car center plate assembly bowl liners.
• The liner material used herein has similar mechanical properties to the liner as disclosed in Chierici and Murphy U.S. Pat. No. 4,075,951, but has improved electrical properties.
• The disclosures in Wulff U.S. Pat. No. 4,241,667 and Chierici and Murphy U.S. Pat. No. 4,075,951 are incorporated by reference.
• Railroad cars are commonly in the form of a body resting on and swivelly connected to a pair of trucks adjacent each end of the car.
• The Chierici and Murphy patent discloses a special truck bolster bowl liner that was devised to replace the conventional and troublesome manganese steel liner.
• The invention provides a liner with all the benefits as disclosed in the Chierici et al patent and in addition being conductive, thereby eliminating the need for any additional grounding apparatus.
• The liner is composed of a base ultra high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMW-PE) material with a conductive material additive.
• Other plastics can be formed as ultra high molecular weight material, but polyethylene is preferred both for performance and economic reasons.
• The improved liner still has all of the same properties that make the liner as disclosed in Chierici et al so beneficial, with the additional benefit that the liner is now conductive.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides a valve for controlling the flow of viscous substances from a bag or pouch.
• The valve includes a tubular sleeve mounted on the spout of the bag and a gate valve member that can be moved to open or close the flow.
• The gate valve member is reciprocated on a guide member by means of an integral upward guide and operating channel-like extension.
• The valve can be actuated with one hand only and can be readily disassembled for cleaning and reassembled.
• The valve can function when the valve assembly is in an inclined position and can function when a bag carrying the valve assembly is mounted in a dispenser of the type indicated.
• The valve provides an effective seal when in the closed position and complete cut-off when the valve reaches the closed position.

<summary>

* The present invention provides a vehicle rearview mirror system that is tolerant of different protocols of an output of a vehicle control. (para. 0016)
* The rearview mirror system includes a variable reflective element which assumes a partial reflectance level in response to a drive signal. (para. 0016)
* The mirror control determines the protocol of the output of the vehicle control including monitoring the output of the vehicle control in attempting to conclude a state of the output of the vehicle control. (para. 0017)
* The output of the vehicle control may be gear status information, engine information, alarm information, or door status information. (para. 0017)
* The mirror control may include a microcomputer having software and the microcomputer determines the protocol by software processing. (para. 0017)
* The microcomputer may determine the protocol of the reverse-gear indication including monitoring the reverse-gear indication and attempting to determine when the vehicle is in reverse gear and/or when the vehicle is not in reverse gear. (para. 0017)
* The controller may maintain a reverse-inhibit-running parameter and a reverse-inhibit-ignition-cycle parameter. (para. 0018)
* The power-up sequence may be carried out every time the vehicle is started, namely, whenever the vehicle's ignition line is powered. (para. 0019)
</summary>

<summary>

* The present invention relates to an anti-lock braking system (ABS) for motorcycles, particularly for a front wheel brake.
* The ABS system is directed to an anti-dive device with a damped telescopic front suspension.
* The system senses the nearly-locked condition of the front wheel and shuts off the hydraulic pressure to the brake to prevent wheel lock.
* The invention improves braking efficiency by reducing the decrease in front wheel load during braking, which in turn reduces the resistance to locking of the brake.
</summary>

<summary>
    1. The present invention includes an improved partition system in which at least two panels are independently attached to one or more mounting assemblies, allowing each panel to be moved independently.
    2. The partition system includes a rail system, a trolley assembly, and a panel hingedly attached to the rail system.
    3. The rail system is slidably attached to the trailer walls or ceiling, and the trolley assembly permits the panel to be moved in the fore and aft direction and secured to the ceiling when not in use.
    4. The panels are slidably attached to the rails with a trolley assembly, and the trolley assemblies permit the panels to be moved in the fore and aft direction and secured to the ceiling when not in use.
    5. The panels can be moved from a stowed position to an operative position by lifting the bottom of the panel up and to the rear of the trailer, and moving the panel fore or aft to position the base of the panel proximate to a strap having a hook.
    6. The strap is secured to the base of the panel, and the hook is secured to the base of the panel, preferably by attachment to a cooperating receptacle.
    7. The assemblies may be advantageously modified to provide additional or different functionalities, such as using a post or flange integrally molded into the panel and adapted to be received into the rails, or using an integral, one-piece, arcuate tab attached to the top of the bulkhead that can be inserted into one of a plurality of longitudinally arranged receiving means at a predetermined angle.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a sanitizable rotary valve that may be used in conjunction with liquid chromatography and other processes.
• The valve has a rotor and a stator with multiple ports, and a sealing means comprising a diaphragm that seals the ports.
• The invention also includes a SIP/barrier gutter located on an inner surface of the valve for sanitizing the valve.
• The valve can be actuated by orthogonal actuating means, and fluid connection means for fluidly connecting stator and rotor connection ports to externally located fluid sources and chromatographic separation devices.
• The invention is directed to an insert molding process for forming a rotary valve diaphragm seal.
• The objects of the invention include providing a sanitizable slider valve, a fluid barrier stream that purges the external limits of the port-sealing faces, and a simple and reliable elastomeric means of ensuring sealing of all ports in a slider valve.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to gas-liquid contacting trays and improvements in valve-tray assemblies.
• The invention includes an improved tray valve assembly for a process column, which comprises a plurality of apertures formed in the tray, a valve cover mounted thereon, and first and second legs mounted to the tray in outwardly slotted portions for defining the orientation of the valve relative to the liquid flow.
</summary>

<summary>

* The present invention relates to a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating a fluid pressure.
* The invention provides a fluid pressure regulator assembly that reduces variances in an output pressure as the result of large differences in input pressure.
* The assembly includes a pressurized fluid source, high-pressure line, fluid regulator, output line, and burner.
* The vane motor is coupled to the fluid regulator and is designed to convert pressurized fluid into mechanical power.
* The invention also provides a diver and diving gear utilizing the present invention.

</summary>

<summary>
     * The invention relates to pallet systems, particularly those that facilitate loading and unloading of items.
     * The pallet system features parallel guide rails raised above the top surface of the pallet, with trays slidable along the guide rails.
     * The system includes end stops to limit longitudinal movement of trays, and end plates secured to the stacked trays to provide stability and enhanced load security.
     * The pallet system restricts both lateral and longitudinal movement of items loaded onto the pallet, and provides enhanced stability when loaded and wrapped.
     * The pallet allows trays to be slid on and off, and is suitable for automated loading and unloading of the trays.
     * The invention provides advantages such as improved stability, enhanced load security, and simplified automated loading and unloading processes.
</summary>

* The electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension comprises a saucer shell, a saucer cabin, a rotary-wing system, and a control system. (0021)
* The rotary-wing system is a magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system that includes magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, a magnetic suspension shaft, and a magnetic suspension guide rail. (0021)
* The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels comprise blades, a magnetic suspension inner ring, and a magnetic suspension outer ring. (0021)
* The magnetic suspension inner ring of the magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels goes around the magnetic suspension shaft in the radial direction and is disposed between the inner ring upper guideway and the inner ring lower guideway in the axial direction. (0022)
* The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels of the electrical driven flying saucer are suspended on the magnetic suspension shaft in the radial direction and are embedded in the electromotive ring in the radial direction and disposed between the outer ring upper guideway and the outer ring lower guideway in the axial direction. (0022)

<summary>
• The present invention concerns streptavidin muteins, a process for their production, and their use in the isolation, purification, and detection of biological substances.
• The invention aims to optimize the binding affinity of streptavidin for peptide ligands, which can be used for the isolation and purification of recombinant proteins.
• The inventors found that the binding affinity for the streptavidin/peptide ligand system can be improved by mutations in the region of amino acid positions 44-53 of streptavidin.
• The preferred streptavidin muteins according to the invention have at least one mutation in the region of amino acid positions 44-47, particularly Val 44 -Thr 45 -Ala 46 -Arg 47 (SEQ ID NO: 6) or Ile 44 -Gly 45 -Ala 46 -Arg 47 (SEQ ID NO: 8).
• The invention also concerns a polypeptide that carries at least one label, and a nucleic acid that codes for the streptavidin.
• The invention provides a method for the isolation and purification of recombinant proteins using the streptavidin muteins, which can be used for detecting and purifying biological substances.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to methods of forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts.
2. The methods involve treating guanylating agents with a compound selected from the group consisting of amines.
3. The nickel catalysts used in the inventive methods preferably comprise nickel in the zero oxidation state.
4. Suitable Ni(0) catalysts are preferably derived from nickel-boride alloys, nickel-phosphide alloys, aluminum-nickel alloys, nickel on kieselguhr, and nickel on silica/alumina.
5. The guanylating agents used in the inventive methods are typically thioureas and isothioureas.
6. The invention also relates to a process for synthesizing N-substituted and N,N-disubstituted guanidines from bis-protected thioureas in the presence of a nickel catalyst.
7. The methods of the invention can be used to synthesize N-arylsulfonyl protected methylisothioureas, N-diphenyl-S-methylisothiourea, and 1,3-diphenyl-S-methylisothiourea, which can be used to guanylate aliphatic and aromatic amines.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a novel apparatus and method for continuously electrolytically coloring aluminum strips or wires.
• The method involves anodizing the aluminum article in an anodic oxidation bath to form an anodic coating, and then electrolytically coloring the oxide coating in an electrolyte containing a specific acid or water-soluble metal salt.
• The invention provides an apparatus for continuous electrolytic coloring of an aluminum strip or wire, comprising a means for continuously supplying an aluminum strip or wire, an anodic oxidation bath for anodizing the aluminum strip or wire, an electrolytic coloring bath for electrolytically coloring the anodized aluminum strip or wire, and an electric circuit for connecting the cathode and anode to a power source.
• The invention also provides a method for continuously electrolytically coloring aluminum strips or wires, comprising the steps of anodizing the aluminum article in an anodic oxidation bath, electrolytically coloring the oxide coating in an electrolyte containing a specific acid or water-soluble metal salt, and sealing the colored article.
• The invention offers improved coloring efficiency and weatherability compared to conventional methods, and allows for the continuous production of colored aluminum articles.

<summary>
     * The present invention relates to a process of producing transgenic plants or plant cells transformed on a chromosome with a DNA sequence of interest and capable of expressing a function of interest from said DNA sequence of interest.
     * The process involves providing plant cells or plants with at least two different vectors, which are adapted to recombine with each other by site-specific recombination in the plant cells for producing a non-replicating recombination product containing the DNA sequence of interest.
     * The DNA sequence of interest contains sequence portions from at least two of the at least two different vectors, which are necessary for expressing the function of interest from the DNA sequence of interest.
     * The process has many important applications, including DNA library screening, gene function analysis, and directed evolution including gene shuffling.
     * The inventors have surprisingly found that transiently delivered T-DNA can be efficiently used for in planta engineering of a sequence of interest for integration into a chromosome, with an efficiency comparable to that for a standard Agrobacterium-mediated transformation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor that uses a coated aluminum swash plate to reduce frictional wear on the components.
• The coating is applied to the swash plate using a liquid spray and includes a polyfluoro elastomer, a lubricious additive, and a load bearing additive.
• The coating provides a low coefficient of friction surface and enables the use of low silicon alloy aluminum without the need for metal plating or high finish polishing.
• The invention is different from prior swash plate designs having fluororesin coatings by bonding and then cross-linking the fluorocarbon directly to the aluminum, which provides a more durable and efficient compressor.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to organic polymers suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings on semiconductor devices, particularly for use in photolithography processes using KrF and ArF light sources.
• The invention provides novel chemical compounds for use in anti-reflective coatings, as well as preparation methods and compositions thereof, which can absorb light strongly at specific wavelengths to prevent standing wave effects and light reflection in lithography processes.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic.
* The film comprises at least one white pigment and one flame retardant and has good orientability and thermoformability, and very good optical and mechanical properties, and can be produced cost-effectively.
* The invention further relates to the use of this film and to a process for its production.
* The film is made from a crystallizable thermoplastic, and the flame retardant is fed directly during the production of the film by way of masterbatch technology.
* The film does not embrittle on brief exposure to heat, and no embrittlement occurs after 100 hours of heat-conditioning at 100° C. in a circulating-air oven.
* The film passes the UL 94 test and is classified in class 94 VTM-0, meaning that it is suitable for outdoor applications and/or critical indoor applications.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an improved method for producing 143a by continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-dichloroethane using heterogeneous catalysis.
• U.S. Pat. No. 3,231,519 discloses the use of a coprecipitated iron hydroxide and rare earth oxide catalyst for the hydrofluorination of 1,1-trichloroethane to 1,1,1-trifluoroethane.
• U.S. Pat. No. 3,803,241 discloses a catalyst composed of chromium (III) chloride supported on alumina, which was dried at 200° C. using nitrogen or air, followed by HF activation at 250° C. for 2 hours.
• U.S. Pat. No. 3,833,676 discloses a liquid phase batch process for producing 143a by hydrofluorination of methyl chloroform, which requires a long contact time and is less productive compared to continuous gas phase processes.
• U.S. Pat. No. 3,904,701 discloses a bismuth containing catalyst supported on alumina, which was activated using hydrogen fluoride at 250° C. and then passed over the catalyst bed at room temperature to produce 143a.
• Other patents disclose various methods for producing 143a, including the use of antimony pentachloride in a liquid phase process, alumina coated with Cr 2  O 3  and NiO in a gas phase process, and hydrofluorination of vinylidene fluoride. However, these methods have limitations such as low selectivity, low yield, or the need for additional separation equipment.

<summary>
• The invention relates to an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of compounds having the formula: •
• The process involves the use of hypophosphorous acid to reduce the amount of elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities formed during the reaction. •
• The process is straight-forward and readily carried out, making it an attractive option for industry. •
• The use of hypophosphorous acid results in the formation of H2S rather than sulfur, which is a gas and can be easily removed from the reaction zone. •
• The process generates less sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities than when no hypophosphorous acid is present. •
• The invention provides several advantages over traditional methods, including increased yield and purity of the desired product. •
• The process can be used to prepare a 3,6-di-substituted-1H-pyrazolo[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazole having the formula: •
• The process involves reacting an acylated compound with an aqueous mixture of hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric acid or hydrobromic acid to produce hydrogen sulfide and the pyrazolotriazole. •
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from a plurality of fiber types by sequentially taking, from different fiber lots, partial quantities which are small with respect to the entire quantity of the mixture.
• The method involves measuring the entire momentary quantity of the stored fiber lot prior to the first pass or prior to each pass of the bale opener, calculating a partial quantity corresponding to a predetermined proportion of the momentary entire quantity, and removing the partial quantity from the fiber bale continuously.
• The partial quantity is determined anew for each fiber bale, and if instead of the determined partial quantity, a larger or smaller partial quantity is removed, the deviation can be corrected during the next pass.
• The method is particularly adapted for making mixtures of throughout constant quantity proportions, and the bale opener removes fiber material from each fiber lot until the intended quantity is reached.
• The apparatus includes a bale opener for removing fibers from the various stored fiber lots, a quantity measuring device associated with the opener, and a control device which controls the mode of operation of the opener.
• The quantity measuring device may be a height-measuring arrangement which effects a simple and accurate determination of the partial fiber quantities to be removed from the bales.
• The control device has a control apparatus and a computer, and the control apparatus determines the precise partial quantities to be removed and controls the fiber removing operation.
• The control apparatus has additional functions, such as controlling the beginning and end of the bale opening operation regarding the removal of the partial fiber quantity, and the drive of the bale opener is a pole-reversible electromotor which accelerates the operation of the bale opener if necessary.
• The method and apparatus provide a improved method of opening fiber bales without fiber residuals and ensure that an optimally homogeneous mixture is obtained.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics, wherein the yarns are laid at an angle of between 30° and 150° to the long axis of the fabric.
• The invention provides a rake mechanism associated with the needles formed on the conveyors, which allows for greater control of strength and uniformity in the formed layers, and enables parallel courses of yarn to be placed on moving conveyors with partial overlapping of return courses.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in and through warp sheds in a multiple-color air jet loom.
• The invention aims to provide a method and apparatus for carrying out weft insertion in a stable condition and avoiding undue consumption of pressurized air.
• The invention provides a pneumatic piping system in a weft insertion apparatus that includes subnozzles divided into different groups for producing different additional weft carrying forces to be applied in warp sheds.
• The invention also provides a control system for the weft insertion apparatus that includes a regulator, a subtank, and on-off valves connected to the subnozzles.
• The invention enables the production of different weft carrying forces by selectively operating the subnozzles dependent on the weft thread to be inserted, or by positioning one of the subnozzle groups more remotely from the warp shed than the other group, changing the effective cross-sectional area of each nozzle orifice, supplying air under different pressures to the subnozzles, or varying the intervals of time in which air is ejected from the subnozzles.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through spinning bast fibres, and a process of making thereof, in particular, relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through twice health-preserving bast fibres and blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres, together with a process of making thereof.
* The invention provides a process for spinning bast fibres that includes health preserving the bast fibres, opening, cleaning, and carding the health preserved bast fibres, drawing the carded health preserved bast fibres into bast fibre strips, and health preserving the bast fibre strips.
* The invention also provides a process for blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres that includes blending the bast fibres with other fibres, opening, cleaning, and carding the blended fibres, drawing the carded blended fibres into multi-fibre strips, and health preserving the multi-fibre strips.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to methods and apparatus for measuring and removing rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of nip presses, particularly those used in papermaking.
* The invention provides a method and apparatus for accurately detecting, measuring, and at least partially removing any effects of rotational variability from a covered roll used in nip presses, allowing for a more accurate display of the nip pressure profile.
</summary>

* The invention relates to a combination electrical cord support for supporting an electrical cord of an electrical appliance and a holder for holding an article. (FIELD OF THE INVENTION)
* The article holder has a pair of tangs detachably received by openings in a mounting brace mounted to the clamp. (FEATURES OF THE INVENTION)
* The cord support has a first rod, a second rod, and a resilient spring section. (DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF THE INVENTION)
* The present invention may be embodied in other specific forms without departing from the spirit or essential attributes thereof. (SUMMARY)

<summary>
• The invention relates to buttonhole controlling devices for a sewing machine.
• The device includes a foot pad that attaches to a presser bar, and a travelling assembly with an initial position relative to the foot pad.
• The travelling assembly moves with work fed during the sewing of a buttonhole and includes a slidable member that can be positioned by a button for which a buttonhole is to be sewn.
• The slidable member positionable by a button carries a tab to actuate a tripping lever on the machine during movement of the assembly and cause the length of a buttonhole formed with the buttonhole device to be limited to that suitable for the button inserted in the travelling assembly.
• An adjustable stop mounted on the travelling assembly engages the tripping lever to terminate the formation of a buttonhole.
• The invention provides a buttonhole controlling device that can be rendered effective regardless of the type of material being sewn to cause buttonhole stitching to close without overlap.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid.
* The apparatus includes a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch.
* The dwell stretch is designed to conduct the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop.
* The invention is particularly useful for treating knitted fabrics, as it allows for effective washing without soiling a white background.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an air flow system for a dry cleaner that induces ambient air into the access opening of the machine whenever the door is opened.
• The air flow system includes a separate intake fan and duct that is interposed between the access opening of the machine housing and the open ends of the interior tubs, and includes a normally closed valve so that during normal operation of the machine the separate intake system is isolated from the solvent vapors developed during the cleaning cycle.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention improves upon conventional nonwoven spun bond systems by solving problems such as spinning speed limitations, energy consumption, machine element cleanliness, web uniformity, capital costs, and process control. (Paragraph [0018])
* The invention incorporates aspects of the meltblown process to help improve web formation control. (Paragraph [0019])
* The invention is flexible and can accommodate a wide variety of polymers for processing. (Paragraph [0020])
</summary>

• The present disclosure relates to a sewing machine, an embroidery unit, and a non-transitory computer-readable medium storing a sewing machine control program that enable easily setting a position, on a work cloth, at which sewing is performed.

• Embodiments provide a sewing machine, an embroidery unit, and a non-transitory computer-readable medium storing a sewing machine control program that enable setting a position, on a work cloth, at which sewing is performed using an ultrasonic wave.

• The sewing machine includes at least one detecting portion, a processor, and a memory. The at least one detecting portion is configured to detect an ultrasonic wave that has been transmitted from a transmission source. The memory is configured to store computer-readable instructions that instruct the sewing machine to execute steps including identifying a position of the transmission source of the ultrasonic wave based on information pertaining to the ultrasonic wave that has been detected by the at least one detecting portion, and controlling sewing based on the position of the transmission source that has been identified.

• Embodiments also provide an embroidery unit that can be attached to and detached from a bed of a sewing machine, and to which an embroidery frame can be attached, and that is configured to move the embroidery frame, the embroidery frame being configured to hold a work cloth. The embroidery unit includes at least one detecting portion and a notifying portion. The at least one detecting portion is configured to detect an ultrasonic wave that has been transmitted from a transmission source. The notifying portion is configured to notify the sewing machine of a detection timing at which the ultrasonic wave was detected by the at least one detecting portion. The embroidery unit is configured to move the work cloth based on a position of the transmission source of the ultrasonic wave that has been identified by the sewing machine based on the detection timing that has been notified by the notifying portion.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a preparation for application onto a cellulosic fabric or textile material, comprising a blend of wool particles or wool powder as a carrier for functional additives.
* The wool particles or wool powder are preferably of macrofibril size or below, and the functional additives are carried by the wool particles.
* The preparation is useful for enhancing the durability of functional enhancements of a cellulosic fabric material, and can be applied using various methods such as printing, padding, or foam application.
* The invention also relates to a method of preparing the preparation, which involves pulverizing the wool fibre into ultrafine powder, adding functional additives, and bonding the mixture to the cellulosic fabric material.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to a frame quilting machine for sewing patterns into large fabrics, such as bedspreads or quilts.
• The invention includes a reprogrammable computer that controls the sewing machine function and a separate computer that controls the quilting table movement in the X-direction, Y-direction, or any X-Y combination direction, allowing for simplified reprogramming of either function without affecting the other.

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a method of making nonwoven fabrics, particularly two-sided fabrics with a three-dimensional image.
2. The invention involves hydroentanglement of precursor webs with a fiber distribution control layer to form a nonwoven fabric.
3. The fabric is subjected to hydroentanglement on a moveable imaging surface having a three-dimensional image transfer device.
4. The use of a fiber distribution control layer helps to limit the intermingling of the fibrous constituents of the precursor webs.
5. The nonwoven fabric exhibits a pronounced three-dimensional image that is durable to abrasion and distortion due to elongation.
6. The invention provides a method for forming a two-sided nonwoven fabric that exhibits different physical characteristics on each side.
7. The fabric can be treated with a performance or aesthetic modifying composition to meet end-use article requirements.
8. The invention includes a method of manufacturing a durable nonwoven fabric using hydroentanglement and a three-dimensional image transfer device.
9. The present invention provides a nonwoven fabric that is suitable for use in various applications, including home, medical, and hygiene products.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric.
* The device includes control means that are actuable by the strip of material to control the switching functions of the sewing machine.
* The device is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture, and it ensures a continuous operation, makes it possible to sew relatively stiff strips of material, and is insensitive to disturbances.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a knitting method and a knit fabric for linking a rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in the collar of a sweater, neck rope portion of a tank top, lower end portion of baseball stockings, a neck rope portion of an apron, or the like.
2. The invention provides a connective knitting method of two tape-shaped knit pieces which is employed in a knitting procedure of a tape-shaped knit piece and a tape-shaped knit fabric knitted thereby.
3. The method comprises steps of: knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces by a flat knitting machine possessing at least a pair of front and rear needle beds, either or both of which are composed to be movable in the longitudinal direction, the two tape-shaped knit pieces being positioned with a boundary between them in the longitudinal direction on either of the front and rear needle beds.
4. The invention is devised to solve the problem of linking the end portions of the tape-shaped knit fabric in a knitting procedure, whereby the end portions of the tape-shaped knit fabric are joined by the knitting machine in a connective knitting method.
5. The method involves overlaying symmetrical loops of the final course of both the knit fabrics across the boundary and binding off the overlaid symmetrical loops gradually until the two pieces are connected by the knitting machine.
6. The knitting machine used in this embodiment is a flat knitting machine having multiple knitting needles disposed on needle beds laid out in a V-form in a side view, with the rear needle bed formed movably in the lateral direction.
7. The invention provides a connective knitting method of two tape-shaped knit pieces which is employed in a knitting procedure of a tape-shaped knit piece and a tape-shaped knit fabric knitted thereby.
8. The method comprises steps of: knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces by a flat knitting machine possessing at least a pair of front and rear needle beds, either or both of which are composed to be movable in the longitudinal

<summary>
• The invention relates to a flexible traction element made of stranded cables, which can be wound and unwound, and a production line for producing the same.
• The production line includes a reel for unwinding the stranded cables, a device for orienting the strands in a precise manner, a heater for preheating the strands, and a cooling trough.
• The invention also relates to a method for embedding at least one stranded cable in a flexible thermoplastic material.
• The stranded cables are sheathed by a flexible thermoplastic material layer, which improves the adhesion between the strands and the plastics material jacket.
• The production line and method ensure increased flexibility in the traction element and improved adhesion over the long term, and deliver band-shaped traction elements of the best commercially available quality.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine.
• The rotary hook arrangement includes a rotary hook housing, a spring rod, and a capsule release device.
• The rotary hook housing includes a hook body and a hook tip, and the spring rod is arranged between two cams on the hook shaft.
• The capsule release device includes a front cam and a rear cam, and the free end of the spring rod is located between the rear cam and the bobbin housing.
• The bobbin housing takes support by engagement of the rear side face of the shoulder on the spring rod, whereby the rod hinders the bobbin housing against co-rotating with the hook body.
• The eccentric rotates the bobbin housing counter to the direction of hook rotation, and the finger gives the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to materials and methods for producing silicon-based micro and nanofibers.
• The invention is directed towards the production of silicon-based micro and nanofibers that can be used in various applications.
• Liquid silanes have been considered as precursors in direct-write fabrication of printed electronics and the production of silicon microwires and nanowires.
• Cyclohexasilane (Si 6 H 12 ) can be transformed into solid polydihydrosilane (SiH 2 ) n  by thermal treatment or light activation via radical polymerization.
• Electrospinning is a viable method for utilizing liquid cyclosilanes and linear or branched silanes in the fabrication of electronic materials.
• The invention offers the ability to tailor chemical composition of Si wires by adjusting precursor chemistries to give electrospun composites that possess targeted conductivities (electrical, thermal and ionic) and maintain structural stability throughout a lifetime of charge/discharge cycles.
• The four-component and five-component inks can be used with other deposition techniques such as thin film deposition techniques.
• The invention is appropriate for any electrospinning technique including use with devices that have multiple nozzles, drums or films.
• The method for making silicon-containing wires with a four-component ink generally comprises combining a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant and a solvent to form a viscous solution and expelling the solution while exposing the stream of viscous solution to a high electric field.
• The method for making silicon-containing wires with a five-component ink generally comprises combining a liquid silane, a polymer, a solid phase, an accelerant and a solvent to form a viscous solution and expelling the viscous solution while exposing the stream of viscous solution to a high electric field.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel.
2. The invention provides an arrangement for controlling tension of threads in a spool creel having a plurality of spool holders.
3. The arrangement includes a plurality of controllers, each coupled to a different corresponding spool holder.
4. Each controller has a brake rotor and an adjustable, tension-responsive braking element coupled to the brake rotor.
5. The arrangement also includes a tensioning lever coupled to the braking element for biasing it.
6. The tensioning lever has a roller adapted to engage and be biased by the threads.
7. The biasing arrangement is operable to occupy an angular position dependent upon thread tension and weight.
8. The invention provides an improved tension control in a creel arrangement where each spool holder is provided with a fluid pressure-sensitive biasing arrangement.
9. The biasing arrangement influences the tensioning lever, and the fluid pressure is controllable in common for all the biasing arrangements.
10. The invention enables the force exercised by the biasing arrangement to be substantially equal in the entire control range since the angle of the working elevation angle of the biasing arrangement attached to the tensioning lever is minimally altered.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a sewing machine detector that detects the position of a sewing needle and the speed of the sewing machine.
• The detector includes a shaft connected to the sewing machine shaft, a light shielding disc mounted coaxially on the shaft, and a module section connected to the light shielding disc.
• The light shielding disc has a base material made of a light-transmitting synthetic resin and is provided with a speed detecting light shielding area, a needle UP position detecting light shielding area, an angle setting scale, and an angle indication.
• The module section includes a light emitting device, an optical fiber cable, a light receiving device, and a circuit board.
• The light emitting device sends light to the light shielding disc through the optical fiber cable, and the light receiving device receives the light reflected from the light shielding disc and sends it to the circuit board.
• The circuit board processes the received light signal and sends it to the control circuit section as a needle UP position or needle DOWN position signal.
• The invention provides a low-price detector for a sewing machine that is durable despite the detrimental effects of vibration and includes a thinner and more compact detecting section.
• The invention also minimizes stress imposed on the optical fibers by minimizing the curvature of the optical fibers.
• The invention does not electrically interfere with the operation of the detector and controller.
• The first, second, and third light shielding discs are mounted coaxially to the shaft connected to the sewing machine shaft.
• The second light shielding disc detects a needle DOWN position and is provided with a needle DOWN position detecting light shielding area and an indicator arrow for indicating an angle.
• The third light shielding disc detects a thread trimmer timing position and is provided with a thread trimmer timing position detecting light shielding area and an indicator arrow for indicating an angle.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns.
• The process involves partial coagulation and drawing of the yarn, completion of the coagulation, washing under specific conditions, drying, and possibly finishing.
• The invention aims to simplify the viscose rayon continuous spinning process, reduce the space take-up of the spinning machines, and obtain a higher degree of white without sacrificing the quality of the yarn.
• The process involves treating the yarn with water having a non-alkaline pH, and washing it under specific conditions to reduce the sulphur content and improve the degree of white.
• The invention offers several advantages over traditional processes, including reduced treatment liquors handling, separation, and recovery, and improved economics.
• A scheme is provided to compare the process according to the invention with traditional processes, showing the advantages of the former in terms of economics and treatment liquors handling.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a small deaeration tank for use in an oxygen bleaching process.
• The tank is designed to deaerate pulp before it is washed, improving the efficiency of the process.
• The tank has an inlet pipe for receiving pulp, an outlet for removing deaerated pulp, and a tangential swirl inducing inlet pipe for inducing a swirling motion in the pulp.
• The tank is typically cylindrical in shape and has an exterior diameter equal to the diameter of the oxygen reactor.
• The tank is closed and may be at either atmospheric pressure or under low pressure.
• The deaeration tank is equipped with a pressure sensor to monitor the pressure within the tank.
• The tank is designed to handle pulp consistencies of 1-5%, with a preferred consistency of 3%.
• The tank is typically 0.75-1.5 times the diameter of the oxygen reactor.
• The inlet pipe is located between the upper surface of the slurry and the top edge of the tank, and extends across the interior of the tank to splash against the side wall of the tank.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to composite materials and biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composites with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio.
* The invention uses a methodology called "function-oriented material design" (FOMD) to design materials for specific tasks, such as supporting static loads, dissipating vibration energy, or absorbing impact energy.
* The FOMD system has resulted in innovative structural material concepts, including BTR composites, which have evenly distributed fibers in the matrix material and can be designed separately for tension and compression.
* The BTR design process involves optimizing the out-plane stiffness of the composite material for a given amount of fiber and matrix materials, and the optimum structure obtained from the concept design implies that the fibers should be concentrated and optimally arranged along the load paths where the reinforcements are most needed.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to a load-limiting device for use in a braced frame during a dynamic event.
• The load-limiting device is designed to plastically deform in response to high lateral loads, absorbing energy and limiting the amount of damage to the structure.
• The device may be easily removed and replaced after plastic deformation with another non-plastically deformed load-limiting device.
• The invention provides a method for using the load-limiting device in a braced frame, integrating it with the structure and checking for plastic deformation after dynamic activity.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a bedroom cabinet designed for use as a flophouse for workers at a construction site or other workplace.
• The cabinet is designed to provide a flat exterior surface, allowing multiple units to be stacked or installed adjacent to each other without any protrusions.
• The cabinet is composed of a hexahedron-shaped outer casing and an inner casing, providing mechanical strength and allowing for the installation of electric devices such as an interphone or illuminating instrument.
• The outer casing is assembled with the inner casing through the use of flanges and a clip member, which resiliently hold the two casings together.
• The present invention also provides a further embodiment of the bedroom cabinet, wherein a clearance is formed between the outer and inner casings to house wiring or other interior electric devices, and a spacer member is interposed in the clearance to provide an uniform air flow passage and increase the sound-proofing effect.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a portable, temporary guard rail support and assembly for use in erecting a safety barrier to provide a safe work area for workmen working at dangerous heights, particularly in the construction industry.
* The guard rail support comprises a flat bottomed base plate, an upright column affixed to the flat bottomed base plate, at least one guard rail support bracket affixed to the upright column, a kick board retaining flange affixed to the flat bottomed base plate in spaced proximal relationship to the upright column, an angular brace affixed to the upright column and the flat bottomed base plate, and a safety tie-off ring affixed to the upright column and the flat bottomed base plate.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to the stimulation of crude oil reservoirs to enhance production using a combination of pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods.
• The invention provides a method and apparatus for recovery of crude oil from oil-bearing soils and rock formations using pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic vibrations that can cause oil flow to be enhanced and increase the estimated ultimate recovery from reservoirs.
• The existing art in stimulating reservoirs has been spotty at best, and the effective range of such methods has been limited to less than 1000 feet from the stimulation source.
• Existing acoustic stimulation methods have demonstrated clearly that they are limited to a range of about 1000 feet from the stimulation point.
• It is desirable to have a stimulation source that has a greater range of effectiveness than the prior art discussed above.
• Hydrocarbons recovered from a wellbore may include a number of components, including crude oil, condensate, liquefaction of the gaseous components, free gas, solution gas, water, and solids.
• The present invention is a pulsed power device and a method of using the pulsed power device for EOR.
• The rapid release of electrical energy stored in capacitor banks can be used either in a direct plasma mode or by discharging the energy through a single- or multiple-turn coil that generates a short-lived but extremely intense magnetic field.
• When electricity stored in capacitors is released across a spark gap submerged in water, a plasma channel is created that vaporizes the surrounding water and generates very high pressures and temperatures as it expands outward from the discharge point.
• In a plasma, or electrohydraulic (EH) mode, the pulse may be used to enhance oil flow in the wellbore.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present disclosure relates to a system and method for splicing a soil reinforcing element to extend its length in an MSE structure.
• The splice may include a first wave plate defining one or more first transverse protrusions configured to receive and seat a corresponding number of transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element, and a second wave plate defining one or more second transverse protrusions configured to receive and seat a corresponding number of transverse wires of a grid-strip.
• The splice may further include a first perforation defined in the first wave plate and a second perforation defined in the second wave plate, and a connective device extensible through the first perforation and the second perforation to couple the first wave plate to the second wave plate.
• The splice may be employed to lengthen the extent of a soil reinforcing element, such as the soil reinforcing element generally described above with reference to FIG. 1.
• The transverse wires of the grid-strip may be equally-spaced or substantially equally-spaced along the length of the longitudinal wires of the grid-strip.
• The splice may include one or more wave plates, such as a first plate and a second plate, and each wave plate may include one or more transverse protrusions longitudinally-offset from each other.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a novel design for a plow blade that provides a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, which is produced with basic manufacturing processes allowing efficient production.
* The invention provides a blade construction including a multiple component assembly, allowing the blade to be rebuilt by replacing a worn portion, and a process of ejecting a specific fluid at specific points along the blade to maximize the desirable characteristics while minimizing the volume of ejected fluid.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a building system, specifically a stucco type cavity wall construction technique and resultant consumables, subassemblies, assemblies, etc.
* The invention aims to provide a building and/or a building system that can create panels of greater than 2.4 meters in height and/or greater than 4 meters width without movement control joints.
* The invention provides a building and/or a building system that can comply with the plaster code NZS4251 and/or the building code NZS3604.
* The invention provides a building and/or a building system that can provide the public with a useful choice.
* The invention provides a building and/or a building system that can meet what is expected to be allowable under NZ regulations.
* The invention provides a building and/or a building system that can provide stucco walled structures with panel rigidity and integrity.
* The invention provides a building and/or a building system that can provide methods to meet what is expected to be allowable under NZ regulations.
* The invention provides a building and/or a building system that can be used for walls of size of at least 2.4 m high, at least 4 m wide and about 21 mm thick.
</summary>

* The background of the invention relates to the field of safes adapted to contain valuable papers and articles.
* The invention provides a new and improved safe and door structure that is readily assembled, low cost, and has a valuables receiving chamber with a generally rectangular opening and inwardly extending ledges on opposing walls for placement of a plate-shaped separate steel door thereon.
* The grooves are formed by elongate bar members or by the walls themselves, and the door is laterally displaced until the latter edge is in abutment with the seat of the shallower groove.
* The lock assembly on the reverse side of the door has the latch bolt engaging a detent in one bar for prevention of lateral movement with reinforcing bolts on both sides of the lock bolt preventing transmission of force to the lock mechanism in the event of forceful intrusion attempts.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method for measuring the fluid pressure in a subterranean formation with greater accuracy, particularly in the case of low-permeability formations.
* The method involves using a conduit placed in a borehole to a depth where the fluid pressure is to be measured, and a non-return valve to prevent liquid from passing upwardly through the conduit. A cementitious material is then placed in the borehole, and a liquid is pumped down the conduit to displace the cementitious material and form a fluid connection to the formation, allowing the pressure sensing device to measure the fluid pressure of the formation at the desired depth.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, used in applications such as new transit systems, monorails, and road bridges.
• The jointing structure comprises more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the steps, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap.
• The invention aims to provide a jointing structure that can prevent tire fallen-in and/or stuck-in situations, ensure high slip resistance to tires, and be easy to maintain.
• The elastic members are desirably of a material that is hard to be deformed vertically and vice versa easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner.
• The use of a joint block made of the same concrete as that of the traveling path may be adapted to provide more substantially increased slip resistance to the tires, as compared with the rubber or steel expansion joint.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a floor transport system for use in a fluid treatment chamber.
• The system includes an enclosed floor track system for transporting wheeled hand trucks into and out of the chamber without contaminating the sanitary environment.
• The track system is structured to accommodate trucks with downwardly depending struts supporting the wheel structure.
• The sidewalls of the wheel channel extend upwardly beyond the top of the wheel structure and include at the top edges thereof inflatable elastomer seals.
• The seals are hose-like and are attached along the length of the sidewall top edges so as to enclose around the hand truck wheel struts and prevent entry of the brine solution into the guide track.
• The elastomer strips provide a seal around the wheel struts, as well as against itself along the remaining length of the floor track.
• The enclosed floor track system prevents showered or dripping brine from entering into the track system, and what little solution which may enter the tracks and become contaminated is drained away separately from the solution on the chamber floor.
• The system prevents the brine solution from being showered onto the wheel structure and becoming contaminated.
• The system is well adapted for use with hand trucks having horizontally axled wheel structures.
• The system includes an open wheel channel into which the wheels of the hand truck are moved in the chamber.
• The system includes a cover plate connected to the outer sidewall by a hinge so that it can be pivoted away from the wheel channel and thereby facilitate the cleaning of the channel.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a lock device for a work machine, particularly a tractor loader backhoe, which is constructed to prevent a boom from being rotated by the weight thereof.
2. The lock device includes an engaging member provided on one of the boom and a boom bracket, and an engaged member provided on the other of the boom and the boom bracket.
3. The engaging member is constituted by a plate formed on one side thereof with a hook part, and on the other side thereof with a slot.
4. The lock device is constructed easily, and by sliding the engaging member along the slot and by touching the guide member with either the first or second surface of the engaging member, the engaging member can be held in the lock position or the lock release position.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to swimming pool vacuum cleaning devices.
• The device has a flexible platform with a central suction portion, adjustment mechanisms on top of the suction head, and a roller assembly with axles rotatably carrying rollers for rotation about the axles between the end portions of spaced apart walls.
• The adjustment mechanisms consist of a frame member connected to the platform, a connector means, and a biasing means.
• The frame member has a central portion and spaced end portions, each with an aperture for receiving an axle.
• The connector means has a head portion received in a counterbore provided in the platform and a threaded shank portion received through an aperture in each weight and cover.
• The invention provides an adjustment mechanism in kit form for use with certain types of prior art suction head assemblies.

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to oil well drilling tools and apparatuses.
2. The invention provides a retrieving tool that can be mounted on the exterior surface of a sub-unit independently of threading on the pipe.
3. The apparatus includes a sub-unit with a mandrel, a collar section, and a retriever section.
4. The retriever section is substantially circular in shape and has a bore for fitting around the mandrel.
5. The interior diameter of the bore is slightly larger than the exterior diameter of the mandrel.
6. The upper angular wall portion of the retriever section serves as a "cap" or hub portion.
7. The lower portion of the retriever section guides the retriever section into the opening of the wear bushing to be retrieved.
8. The apparatus includes groove portions along the exterior surface of the mandrel, which slidably accommodate insertion members on the inner wall of the bore of the retriever section.
9. The retriever section is free to move vertically along the mandrel but is prevented from freely rotating around the mandrel.
10. The apparatus is used to retrieve the wear bushing by threadably engaging the bushing.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention relates to a vibratory tool for downhole use that allows a wireline or other tools to pass through a central passage. *
2. The tool has an annular dump valve that opens and closes without getting slammed against a seat. *
3. The tool has a modular piston stack that can be used in the tool, allowing for more power to be delivered per stroke. *
4. The tool can be run in a manner where high amplitude low frequency oscillating forces are delivered to a stuck fish without impacts of the pistons on the housing. *
5. The tool has a lower end attached to a stuck object or fish and an upper end with a mandrel extending uphole from it. *
6. Within the outer body and extending uphole from the upper end is a mandrel connected to the surface through a string. *
7. The mandrel has a passage in fluid communication with the passage in the string, allowing pressure to be delivered from the surface to lateral ports. *
8. The tool has a plurality of pistons connected to the mandrel, with each piston having a seal that rides on the surface of a valve. *
9. The valve is cylindrically shaped with a seal ring initially riding on the surface of the valve. *
10. The tool can be operated so that there are jarring blows delivered in every cycle or by avoiding such jarring blows, depending on the amount of surface overpull applied to the string before and during when the passage is pressurized. *
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an apparatus and method for constructing a retaining wall.
* The invention provides an apparatus and method for constructing a retaining wall that allows for taller walls and shorter bases by pre-manufacturing parts of the wall to be transported to and assembled at the site.
* The retaining wall of the present invention is made of precast concrete in two discrete, modular parts.
* The face panel has an integral counterfort and a precast base piece.
* The counterfort extends from the rear side of the panel and has a flat bottom, so that in side view, the counterfort is generally a right triangle.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to systems and methods for producing or delivering heat at or near the down hole end of production tubing of a producing oil or gas well.
* The existing technologies for heating oil and paraffin down hole have limitations, such as inadequate focus of heat and failure of down hole heaters due to pressure invasion.
* The present invention addresses these limitations by providing a down hole heating system with a heat insulating packer, perforated tubing, stainless steel collar, and heating unit with shielded electrical connections.
* The heating unit is designed to focus and contain heat in the production zone to promote flow to, and not just within, the production tubing.
* The invention also includes a method for use of the system for heat treating an oil or gas well for improving well flow, which includes use of a down hole heating unit with suitably shielded electrical connections and installation of the heat-retaining elements.
* The invention can be used in various applications, including deep gas wells with an iron sulfide occlusion problem, and can be substituted with cable (wire line) for supporting the heating unit during pipe pulling.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to down hole tools for conducting mechanical activities in wells, specifically a mechanism for installation and retrieval of objects in wells.
• The mechanism includes an external pull tool or overshot that is adapted for use in well servicing operations or an internal pull tool or spear, depending on the service operation.
• The tool structure takes the form of an outer tubular body having an inner body structure disposed in movable relation therein, and telescoping movement of the inner and outer body structures causes the overshot or spear to selectively move into gripping relationship with the object to be removed from the well bore.
• The catch mechanism includes a pin structure forming a part of the tool and a control spring that ensures that the pin alternately enters one or the other of a pair of unlocking or locking grooves each time the inner and outer body structures are cycled linearly relative to one another.

<summary>
• The present application claims the benefit under 35 U.S.C. §365(a) of PCT International Patent Application Ser. No. PCT/MX2011/000063.
• The example embodiment relates to stave floors, particularly to modular composed stave floors.
• The conventional composed stave floor or conventional engineering floor includes at least a base substrate (after face) and a sight substrate, of finished (face) or top part for the traffic surface.
• The conventional composed stave floor or conventional engineering floor exhibited detachment after a short period of time.
• A test of deformation was conducted by applying the glue in conventional form to the sight substrate, of finished (face) or top part for the traffic surface, resulting in a simple sight perceptible frizziness.
• The example embodiment manufactured a composed stave floor or engineering floor including a base substrate (after face) having a thickness of 15 mm and a sight substrate, of finished (face) or top part for the traffic surface having thickness of 6 mm.
• The assembly of both substrates was carried out by gluing both substrates using multidirectional holding means: dendrite (15), in conjunction with adhesion and horizontal reinforcement means in the union plane: glue; and adhesion and reinforcement vertical means normal to the union plane: clamp, divergent clamp and/or cemented clamp (30).
• The composed stave floor of the present invention thus obtained did not present deformation or any detachment.
• The example embodiment provides floors with increased durability.
• The variations are not to be regarded as a departure from the spirit and scope of the example embodiments, and all such modifications as would be obvious to one skilled in the art are considered to be included within the scope of the following claims.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to ladders and more particularly to ladder attachments for positioning the ladder away from the work surface, preventing the ladder from defacing the work surface, and preventing the ladder from slipping or sliding.
• The problem with ladders is that there is instability when painting or cleaning the exterior of a house because the ladder rests on the side of the house with a small contact area, causing the center of gravity to shift and the rails to slide along the work surface.
• Another problem is that the siderails of the ladder rest on the work surface with a small contact area, which can damage the work surface.
• The present invention is directed to overcoming these problems by providing a brace for a ladder that has a large contact area.
• The brace includes an extension arm with a flange on one end and an opening in the distal end. A U-bolt is inserted through the flange, and nuts are threaded onto the legs of the U-bolt to secure the flange to the U-bolt.
• The invention provides a non-slip gripping portion for a ladder that grips the work surface without damaging the work surface, effectively increasing the contact area of the ladder with the work surface, and improving the lateral stability of the ladder.
• The invention also allows the ladder to straddle corners without losing stability.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to collated fasteners, specifically nail strips with a plastic collation system.
* The collation system reduces the tendency for the plastic to generate debris as the nail is driven into the workpiece.
* The collation system includes a collar portion that captures or at least substantially encircles the fastener shank and a connecting portion extending between and connecting adjacent fasteners.
* The connecting portion can be formed as a bridge and a rib, with the rib having a generally cruciform shape.
* The rib can be formed parallel to the collation, or at an angle relative to the collation.
* The connecting portion can include a preferentially weakened region to influence separation of the connecting portion from the collar at a desired location, reducing debris by reducing the impact on the connecting portion by the fastener as it is driven by the tool into the substrate.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants, particularly silicones, in various industries.
* The nozzle comprises a bell or hood lower section and an injection button connected thereto.
* The invention provides several advantageous and novel characteristics for its intended function, including a non-permanent connection between the button and the bell section.
* The nozzle is designed to encapsulate rivets or nuts and provide a connection element for sealing operations.
* The injection button has a special design with multiple channels and orifices for guiding the injection of the sealant around rivets and nuts.
* The button section allows the user to apply sealant operations both manually and by automated sealant injection machines.
* The invention is applicable in various industries, including aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
* The bell or hood lower section is designed to seal the rivets or nuts, and the injection button is used to guide the sealant around them.
* The invention provides a nozzle that once connected to a cartridge or injection machine facilitates the injection of sealants in multiple industrial applications.
* The invention improves upon existing nozzles in the market by providing a non-permanent connection between the button and the bell section, allowing for easier cleaning and maintenance.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to sensors, particularly position and motion sensors, and methods for reducing the number of wires required for monitoring multiple sensors.
• The invention provides a method of multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires with a minimum of energy required from each sensor monitoring system.
• One embodiment of the invention is a sensor that includes a waveform generator and an error correction generator for modifying a sensing signal and providing a conditioned sensing signal to a remote monitor via two wires.
• The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about a position of an object being sensed.
• The invention includes a window reference circuit that constantly compares a desired conditioned sensor signal output to an existing conditioned sensor signal output and adjusts the conditioned sensor signal output if it is above a preset high reference signal or below a preset low reference signal.
• The invention may include a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation circuit for constantly comparing a value of the conditioned sensing signal to a desired minimum value and generating a correction signal that is subtracted from the offset and error signal to deliver a sensor signal output that is close to a desired minimum value.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to valve actuation in internal combustion engines.
• The invention provides a desmodromic valve actuation system that is springless and infinitely variable.
• The system uses a rotating cam and translating means to control valve position.
• The valve is moved up and down by a link that is rotated by an adjustable member.
• The adjustable member has a slot that allows a pin to slide along a line of action and rotate the link.
• The invention provides computer control of each valve for variable valve displacement.
• The invention can be used in any number of cylinders, including 2, 4, 6, or 8 cylinders.
• The invention can be controlled by one controller for each cylinder or two controllers, one controlling two pistons and the other controlling four pistons.
• The invention provides a smooth and infinitely variable valve actuation system that is simple in operation and precisely controlled.
</summary>

<summary>
     * The present invention relates to aquarium lighting, specifically LED-based aquarium lighting.
     * The invention discloses a light member that includes a housing, a lighting control region, and one or more light-emitting modules.
     * The lighting control region is disposed on the bottom side of the housing and includes a first control channel, a second control channel, and a neutral channel.
     * The light-emitting modules are electrically connected to the first control channel, the second control channel, and the neutral channel and are releasably coupled to the lighting control region.
     * The invention also discloses a switch assembly coupled to the housing and operable to selectively deliver power to the first control channel and the second control channel.
     * The invention provides a dual in-line timer for a light-emitting module and a radio frequency (RF) light-emitting module according to another construction.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine, particularly a gas turbine.
