* The apparatus has a blade with a hollow airfoil section and a blade root, and a number of cooling channels through which a cooling fluid flows.
* The cooling fluid flows along the insides of the hot-gas walls and emerges to the outside through appropriate film-cooling openings.
* The separating walls, which are used to bound the cooling channels, are separate inserts composed of metal or non-metal materials.
* The inserts are inserted through the blade root or tip and are secured there.
* The use of inserts instead of cast separating walls has several advantages, including no large amount of material in the transitional region, no thermal stresses between the insert and the hot-gas wall, and reduced weight and improved centrifugal-force stresses.
* The inserts can be easily adjusted by replacing them or by introducing connecting cross sections between two cooling channels.
* The invention can be applied to various types of flow deflection apparatuses, including rotor blades that rotate at high speed.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, such as a throttle valve.
* The system comprises a control unit that receives a signal indicating accelerator pedal position and a signal indicating the position of the throttle valve, and provides an output signal for controlling a DC motor or a stepper motor that drives the throttle valve.
* The invention provides a smooth switchover from manual to automatic control without causing the vehicle to lurch forward or stall, and allows for manual control of the vehicle during manual mode.
</summary>

<summary>
• It is an object of the invention to provide a waste fuel burner that emits minimal quantities of particulate matter within regulated limits.
• The invention provides a waste wood fuel burner that operates on wet wood of 70% moisture content and produces little slag or clinkers.
• The burner can burn wood of nominal ash content (e.g., 5% ash) and produce a residue free of clinkers.
• The burner is self-regulating, easy to control, and has fast response times, comparable to conventional gas and oil burners.
• The invention burns wood of nominal ash content (e.g., 5% ash) and produces a residue free of clinkers.
• The swirl air and secondary combustion air interact to maintain good separation of particulate from the gas stream leaving the primary chamber.
• The invention can be used for any source of dirty particulate-laden combustible gas and effectively burn the gas to provide a source of useful heat and remove the particulate for meeting environmental emission standards.
• The primary chamber is lined with refractory material and spaced from an outer metallic shell by an air cooling passage.
• Fuel is fed from a hopper and pushed into a conical pile, and preheated underfire air is directed into the pile to dry and gasify the fuel.
• High pressure swirl air is admitted tangentially into the primary chamber to drive the heavier non-combusted materials to the outer wall while allowing the volatile gases to pass upward through the throat of the primary chamber.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a highly efficient evaporative cooling apparatus that operates by conjunction of features, including:
* A heat exchanger that separates its dry and wet sides, evaporating water is kept separate from the useful air, and the major portion of the working air is drawn from the load, i.e., the working air is recirculated from the enclosure to be cooled to the wet side of the heat exchanger.
</summary>

<summary>
    1. In one aspect, there is provided a fluid pump comprising: *a first pump head comprising a first housing containing a first impeller configured to move fluid through at least three first conduits in fluid communication with the first housing;
2. *a second pump head comprising a second housing containing a second impeller configured to move fluid through at least three second conduits in fluid communication with the second housing;
3. *a third pump head disposed between and in fluid communication with the first and second pump heads, the third pump head comprising a third housing containing a third impeller configured to move fluid through at least three third conduits in fluid communication with the third housing;
4. *a drive structure passing through the inlet between the first and second pump heads, the drive structure configured to commonly drive the first, second and third impellers;
5. *in another aspect, there is provided a fluid pump comprising: *two or more pump heads configured in series so that fluid being pumped moves from a reservoir into one pump head and thence to the next pump head in the series, to be eventually discharged from an outlet in a final pump head;
6. *each pump head comprising a housing within which an impeller is contained, the impeller being driven by the drive structure to move fluid;
7. *the drive structure may comprise any one or collection of structures that is configured to impart rotational motion on the impellers.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to engine compression release brakes for less than all engine cylinders.
• The invention includes an engine housing defining a plurality of engine cylinders, and an engine compression release brake provided for each of a portion of the engine cylinders.
• The engine compression release brake is operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve.
• Each cylinder defined by the engine housing has a movable piston, and each piston is movable between a retracted, downward position and an advanced, upward position.
• For a typical four cycle diesel engine, the advancing and retracting strokes of the piston correspond to the four stages of engine operation.
• When the piston retracts from its top dead center position to its bottom dead center position for the first time, it is undergoing its intake stroke and air can be drawn into the cylinder via an intake valve.
• When the piston advances from its bottom dead center position to its top dead center position for the first time, it is undergoing its compression stroke and air within the cylinder is compressed.
• At around the end of the compression stroke, fuel can be injected into the cylinder by a fuel injector, and combustion within the cylinder can occur instantly due to the high temperature of the compressed air.
• The engine compression release brake can occur within the engine during those engine cycles where injection and combustion do not occur.
• The engine compression release brake is operably connected to the exhaust valve for the cylinder, and can be opened during the compression stroke of the piston by the engine brake.
• The engine compression release brake can be connected to any suitable number of engine cylinders that is less than the total number of cylinders defined by the engine housing.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to support structures, particularly a link assembly between an engine and a gearbox.
• The link assembly includes a male link coupled to the engine or the gearbox, and a female link coupled to the engine or the gearbox, wherein the female link receives the male link to allow translation of the male link relative to the female link and to form a radial interface.
• The radial interface dampens translation of the male link relative to the female link.
• The link assembly also includes a pin releasably coupled to the male link and the female link to selectively retain the male link and the female link.
• The invention is particularly pointed out and distinctly claimed in the claims at the end of the specification.
• The embodiments described in the specification include a gearbox assembly to attach to an engine, which includes a gearbox and a link assembly to couple the engine to the gearbox.
• The link assembly includes a male link coupled to the engine or the gearbox, and a female link coupled to the engine or the gearbox, wherein the female link receives the male link to allow translation of the male link relative to the female link and to form a radial interface.
• The radial interface dampens translation of the male link relative to the female link.
• The link assembly also includes a pin releasably coupled to the male link and the female link to selectively retain the male link and the female link.
• The embodiments are useful in aircraft gas turbine engines, where the gearbox assembly is subjected to severe shocks and vibrations, particularly during blade-off events.
• The invention provides a mounting link that can absorb extreme loads without detaching the gearbox from the engine or transmitting potentially destructive loads from the engine to the gearbox.
• The mounting link includes a female link and a male link that can translate relative to each other after a pin is broken or otherwise released, allowing for a permitted range of motion.
• The female link and the male link are formed with any suitable geometry and material, and can be attached to the engine and the gearbox using any suitable feature or component.
• The pin selectively prevents the relative translation of the female link and the male link, and can be in an interference

<summary>
* The invention relates to archery equipment and particularly to apparatus and methods for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts and for balancing arrow shafts.
* The present invention provides a small, lightweight point cap system that can be adjusted to obtain perfect balance, and a balance pin whose weight can be adjusted to balance an arrow shaft.
* The invention also relates to means for uniformly encapsulating or capping the end of an arrow shaft with a material that has nearly the same strength properties in all directions, like steel or aluminum, and to a nock cap adaptor for attaching nocks to the end of an arrow shaft.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to military weapons and simulators, particularly the Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES).
• The SAFES simulates small arms fire noise and flash without modifying the weapon or using mechanical actuation.
• The invention utilizes a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system.
• The expendable contains a plurality of rounds and is installed in a firing unit which can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech.
• The SAFES produces sound and flash by the electrical ignition of the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion produced in a manner which utilizes the weapon's ejection port.
• The invention provides a reliable, low maintenance, reusable small arms training device.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that improves performance by utilizing the dynamic effects of the air flow.
• The device comprises a tank, a first pipe, and a second pipe interconnected by a valve that opens and closes in response to the engine load.
• The valve is disposed in the first pipe and is actuated by an actuator that is controlled by a controller based on an input representing the engine load condition.
• The invention improves engine performance by reducing noise from the air intake and optimizing the valve operation based on the engine load, preferably opening the valve only when the load is above a certain threshold.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a bracket for use in mounting speakers or other equipment to a pole, flat surface, or other structure.
• The bracket assembly consists of two major components: a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, which can be used to mount a product on a pole, pipe, column, or the like, and allow the product to be easily aimed in a particular direction.
</summary>

* The disclosed concepts relate to a burner and a system for removably attaching heat utilizing appliances thereto. (0005)
* The burner has a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder, and air flows both through the fuel holder to support initial combustion and also around the fuel holder to be directed to flame and fumes just above the fuel holder to support secondary combustion. (0006)
* The burner has legs holding the combustion chamber well above ground level, and a pivotally coupled ash pan. (0007)
* The burner has manual couplings for removably coupling modular heat utilizing appliances to the burner, and the modular heat utilizing appliances include closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer. (0008)
* The nature of the disclosed concepts will become apparent upon further review of the specification and drawings. (0010)

<summary>
1. *The invention relates to a combustion engine, specifically a rotary internal combustion engine, and more particularly to an ignition and cooling system combination that improves cooling characteristics to reduce the possibility of structural failure of the engine's housing.
2. *The invention aims to provide a housing structure for a rotary internal combustion engine that facilitates circumferential cooling flow in the rotor housing while permitting the intrusion of spark plug bosses therethrough.
3. *The housing structure is designed to minimize thermal distortion, particularly in the zone surrounding the spark plug bosses.
4. *The invention provides a spark plug boss arrangement that is staggered with respect to the direction of flow in the water jacket passageway, which improves the distribution of coolant velocities around the boss surface and hence the engine water jacket.
5. *The bosses are interposed in a circumferential cooling flow passageway of the rotor housing and are staggered with respect to the direction of flow.
6. *The invention employs a predetermined and limited offset from a line extending between the spark plug terminals to avoid detrimental effects on combustion flame propagation while yet allowing for the staggered boss configuration.
7. *Flow diverters or flow controllers are used between the spark plug bosses to ensure a controlled flow regime between the bosses and for strengthening the housing structure.
8. *The invention provides a housing structure for a rotary internal combustion engine that incorporates a predetermined and limited offset from a line extending between the spark plug terminals to improve cooling characteristics and reduce the possibility of structural failure of the engine's housing.

• The present invention relates to turbines and minimizing flow disturbance caused by closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing.
• The invention uses control valve positions as feedback to minimize flow disturbance during turbine control valve operational safety testing.
• The flow is determined as a function of control valve position, and the flow change due to closure of one of the several parallel flow paths during valve testing results in a change to the system that is controlling pressure from N valves to N-1 valves.
• The present invention is a method of using control valve position as feedback into a compensation function to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of a turbine control valve during periodic operational testing.
• The test compensation circuit uses control valve positions as feedback and adjusts the flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closure and reopening of turbine control valve during testing.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mixing valve for combining fluids from two separate sources into one mixture, and more specifically to a valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus.
• The valve system includes a valve body with a first inlet passage for receiving a first fluid, a second inlet passage for receiving a second fluid, and an outlet passage for providing a proportional mixture of the two fluids.
• The valve assembly includes a valve member for directing the two fluids toward the outlet passage, and a flow restricting device for reducing the flow rate of fluid from the first inlet passage to the outlet passage.
• The valve member includes a cylindrical portion with a bore extending therethrough, and a sealing sleeve received on the cylindrical portion for compressing the sleeve against the walls of the bore.
• The valve system further includes a series of consecutive cylindrical spools defined by the valve member, and a set screw for restraining translational motion of the valve member after it is received within the valve body.
• The valve member defines a series of consecutive cylindrical channels disposed between the spools, and a fluid seal ring retained in each channel for sealing the valve assembly.
• The valve system is capable of providing a constant pressure cleaning solution to each user, wherein the cleaning agent to water ratio is continuously adjustable.
</summary>

<summary>

* The present invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas.
* The method includes compressing the gas delivered in the pipeline with an entry pressure in a compression procedure to a higher pressure, subsequently cooling the gas by a heat exchange, and feeding the gas for further transportation to the pipeline with a lower exit temperature.
* The invention also relates to an arrangement for carrying out the method, which includes at least one compressor for compressing gas, heat exchangers for cooling compressed gas, valve-controlled pipelines for connecting the compressor and heat exchangers to the gas pipeline, and control units for controlling the compressor and valves.
* The invention proposes a method of compressing gas in a compressor station that reduces investment and operation risks by compressing the gas to a higher pressure than the desired exit pressure, cooling the compressed gas by heat exchange, and expanding the gas to the desired exit pressure.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a cooling fan mounting system that eliminates the need for fasteners.
* The system is used in applications where free convection cooling is insufficient to cool electronic components.
* The mounting system includes a motor, fan blade, and enclosure, with the motor housing integrally formed with the motor carrier.
* The motor carrier includes mounting legs that are urged away from the panel by spring members.
* The system eliminates the need for fasteners by using the spring members to urge the motor carrier against the panel.
* The spring members are designed to prevent the motor carrier from moving due to vibrational forces.
* The system provides a low-cost solution for keeping electronic components operating within acceptable temperature ranges.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a damped instrument kinematic mount that incorporates novel damping features to protect the instrument from potentially damaging flight loads.
* The mount comprises instrument support means with first and second damping means, which are arranged to provide desired performance characteristics.
* The device can be applied to a large number of precision or optical instruments where alignment stability is important, and it fulfills two major requirements: 1) it must not adversely affect the stability of the instrument through the attachment to a less precise spacecraft structure, and 2) it must provide a strong and stable support system to the instrument during launch and minimize the loads transmitted to the mounted instrument.
* The invention provides a passive energy dissipating mechanism to protect the instrument from potentially damaging flight loads, and it is expected to have modal vibration tests on coupon sample mounts that yield modal damping values of 5-17% of critical damping, which are at least one to two orders of magnitude greater than existing designs.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to clutch units of the oil shear type, particularly for large size power transmission applications.
* The clutch unit comprises an input shaft, an output shaft, a plurality of clutch plates connected to one of the shafts, and a plurality of clutch discs interleaved between the clutch plates.
* The clutch discs extend outwardly from the clutch plates and each disc comprises a plurality of arcuate segments in a circumferential arrangement.
* The invention provides an improved oil shear type clutch unit that utilizes hydraulic fluid for dual purposes: retracting the plate actuating means and as a coolant for the clutch discs.
</summary>

• Inventive engine features downstream expansion cylinders associated with a combustion cylinder to provide an overall surface area and volumetric displacement of expansion cylinders sufficient to lower the temperature of fluids associated with the combined engine to such an extent that a radiator can be eliminated in an associated vehicle, or other system.

• A catalytic material is placed on surfaces which will “see” the hot exhaust gases such that catalytic conversion of impurities in the gases can be achieved within the engine itself.

• Water is recovered from a system having both a water injection expansion cylinder and a combustion cylinder, and the recovered water is re-used for the expansion.

<summary>
• The invention concerns the fabrication of plates or blanks of coated steel intended to be welded and then heat treated to obtain parts having good mechanical characteristics and good corrosion resistance.
• The fabrication method described in patent EP 0971044 can be applied to butt-welded blanks in the following manner: starting from steel plate, possibly of different compositions or thicknesses, and having a metal pre-coating, butt-welded blanks are obtained by a welding process. These welded blanks then undergo heat treatment to form a surface alloy and are then hot-pressed and quenched.
• However, this fabrication method runs into considerable difficulties: when welding coated steel blanks, a portion of the initial surface pre-coating is transferred into the molten area created by the welding operation. These exogenous metal elements are concentrated in particular by strong convection currents in the liquid metal.
• The present invention provides a plate consisting of a steel substrate and a precoat consisting of a layer of intermetallic alloy in contact with the substrate, topped by a layer of metal alloy. On at least one precoated face of the plate, an area situated at the periphery of the plate has the metal alloy layer removed.
• The invention also provides a method of fabricating a precoated steel plate that includes coating a steel plate to obtain a precoat having an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer, on at least one face of the plate, removing the metal alloy layer in an area not totally contiguous with the periphery of the plate and cutting the plate in a plane so that the area from which the metal alloy has been removed is at the periphery of the cut plate.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a remote control system and algorithm for supervisory control and data acquisition in an offshore energy recovery system.
2. The system includes an offshore mobile energy recovery structure, a control, communication, and computer system running server and client software applications, and electromechanical circuits for actuating control of various mechanisms affecting position and velocity of the mobile structure.
3. The algorithm optimizes energy extraction using yield functions derived from weather and geospatial data and vessel performance models.
4. The system applies to remote control of any system that exploits energy from weather patterns that avail formidable amounts of naturally occurring energy.
5. The system comprises a central service facility for the purpose of service logging, maintenance, and bulk energy storage for later distribution.
6. The communication system includes GPS, weather satellites, and telecommunications satellites.
7. The system tracks the position and velocity of the mobile structure through a GPS system.
8. The system uses weather satellite data to track weather patterns and predict energy extraction yields.
9. The system can be used in a variety of embodiments, including sailing vessels, propelled vessels, barges, and floating platforms with wind turbines or lightening rods.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from a sheet metal material.
* The cage is composed of several rolling body guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction.
* The ring element is composed of at least three flat material ring segments joined together in succession in the circumferential direction.
* The flat material ring segments are welded together via joints.
* The joints form engagement zones within which the flat material ring segments are connected.
* The flat material ring segments are cut out from a sheet metal material.
* The cutting waste is significantly reduced in the manufacturing process.
* The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments which are joined together in the circumferential direction.
* The flat material ring segments are welded together in the region of the engagement zones.
* The welding is performed by laser welding or pressure welding.
* The ring segments are punched out from a strip material and are inserted into an annular groove of a rotary plate.

</summary>

* The present invention relates to methods and systems for obtaining information associated with a customer's service location, such as latitude and longitude coordinates.
* The invention provides a technician server for receiving data transmissions from an input device at a customer service location, and a mapping system for generating directions based on the coordinates.

<summary>

* The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields.
* The system has two sensors and a digital processor.
* The sensors measure the amplitude of the interfering field, and the processor calculates control signals for six coils based on the sensor signals.
* The system is designed to compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields.
* The processor combines the sensor signals to create a virtual sensor with three space axes.
* The virtual sensor signals are used to generate control signals for the coils.
* The control algorithm used by the processor is described by a matrix multiplication.
* The system can be used to protect an object against influences of an interfering field.
* The system can be used in a variety of applications, including scanning electron microscopy (SEM).
* The system can be used to generate a homogeneous compensation field, or an inhomogeneous compensation field depending on the nature of the interfering field.
* The system can be used to avoid interferences between two compensation systems operated directly beside each other.

</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method for investigating a sample, derived from a biological source, using CARS microscopy, which involves sensing a resonance signal generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering by excitation of at least one resonance site of the sample by means of laser irradiation.
* The invention aims to provide a method for CARS microscopy that can furnish at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner, which can be used to highlight or make visible chemical structures normally not detectable by means of CARS microscopy.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to a system for assessing segmentations from various sources.
* The system uses an electronic computer executing a stored program to receive first and second electronic files each providing data points describing three-dimensional surfaces circumscribing a structure in a human patient intended for radiation therapy.
* The files are used to generate first and second volume models defined by the first and second electronic files, respectively.
* The system compares the first and second volume models to identify common volume elements, missing volume elements, and extra volume elements.
* The metric method may provide a summation of a first function based on the missing volume elements and a second function based on the extra volume elements.
* The system may also identify a distance measure for each missing volume element from a closest common volume element and a distance measure for each extra volume element from a closest common volume element.
* The electronic computer may display a cross-sectional image through the first and second volume models along a user-defined cross-sectional plane separately identifying the common volume elements, missing volume elements, and extra volume elements by different colors.
* The system may further receive a third electronic file providing a cross-sectional image of patient tissue at the user-defined cross-sectional plane, and display the cross-sectional images through the first and second volume models superimposed on the cross-sectional image of patient tissue obtained from the third electronic file.
* The system may be used for periodic quality assurance of autosegmentation routines or evaluation of those routines when they are updated or used with new imaging technology.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention relates to data processing systems and more particularly to the apparatus for executing floating point operations.
2. The related art in floating point processing includes the use of the microVAX 78132 floating point chip.
3. The addition and subtraction operations in floating point format are more complex than in standard data format due to the need to align fractions prior to addition or subtraction.
4. The present invention provides improved apparatus for the execution of floating point operations, including the use of a difference between a subset of signals of the operand exponent arguments to accelerate an effective subtraction operation.
5. The invention includes a subset difference apparatus that provides a result prior to a determination of the complete difference between the operand exponent arguments.
6. The invention also includes the use of two procedures into which the effective subtraction operations are divided in order to accelerate their execution.
7. The present invention reduces the time required for the effective subtraction operation by beginning the operation based on the difference between a subset of operand exponent argument signals prior to the availability of the complete difference between the operand exponent arguments.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to the collection of blood and medical specimens in a medical facility.
• The invention discloses a method of tracking a specimen acquired from a patient, which includes storing machine-readable codes in a computer storage, selecting a specimen container with a unique machine-readable code, and storing the first-fourth machine-readable codes in the computer storage in a relational manner.
• The method can further include generating an alert signal if the specimen container is out-of-date, and storing an indication of the specimen acquisition in the computer storage in a relational manner with the first-fourth machine-readable codes.
• Each machine-readable code can be unique of the other machine-readable codes.
• The method can include storing an indication of the signal of step (f) in the computer storage in a relational manner with the first-fourth machine-readable codes.
• The first machine-readable code can comprise a barcode that encodes at least one of the following: a unique serial number, the patient's name, a registration number assigned to the patient, the patient's date of birth, the patient's sex, and a code.
• The electronic reading means can be an optical scanner that is communicatively coupled with the computer via a wired or wireless connection.
• The invention also discloses a method of tracking a specimen acquired from a patient, which includes storing machine-readable codes in a computer storage, selecting a specimen container with a unique machine-readable code, and storing the first-fourth machine-readable codes in the computer storage in a relational manner.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to a voice activated distance measuring device for golfers.
• The device uses GPS technology and voice recognition software to provide distance and other information to the user.
• The device may also accept verbal or other data input and memorize and compute this information to predict golf course user golf strategy, club selection, rules, and other golf player needs.
• The device may be used for such applications as hiking, surveyors, and hunters, and other applications.
• The device may be expanded to include its use in any portable application.
• The device may be provided with a communications method, such as a serial, USB, or wireless connection, to facilitate various detailed functions, such as graphical display of the user's score and plot of all ball trajectories viewed against an image of the subject golf course, display of clubs used, comparative display of any other player or players using the system, expert system advice based on data accrued during one or more recorded games, printing of results and scorecards.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to the field of semiconductor design technology and addresses the problem of accurately reporting design rule violations in a system that includes both logic and memory circuits.
* The invention provides a method and system for checking design rules to determine whether a logic part of a mask pattern data obeys logic rules, and whether a memory part of the mask pattern data obeys memory rules.
* The method and system of the invention categorize the results into different categories based on where the errors occur, such as in logic, bordered single port (BDSP) SRAM, borderless single port (BLSP) SRAM, dual port (DP) SRAM, and ROM groups.
* The invention creates customized design rules based on modifying a standard logic rule to take into consideration minimum dimensional values extracted from memory bit cell design parameters.
* The customized design rules are used to check a design in GDS form, depending on the types of regions presented in the IC.
* The design rule check result includes a number of separate error reports for layout violations detected in a layer (or layers) of an IC, including real logic errors, real BDSP SRAM errors, real BLSP SRAM errors, real DP SRAM errors, and real ROM errors.
* The invention provides a solution to the disadvantages of the first and second conventional methods of checking design rules, which are explained in the patent.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to the use of waveguide holograms for illumination of objects requiring controlled illumination.
• The illumination system comprises a thin substrate waveguide optically coupled to a coherent light source, such as a laser.
• The illumination system provides extremely high diffraction efficiencies and uniformity of the diffracted wavefront in the direction of propagation.
• Non-uniformity of the diffracted wavefront can be compensated for by exposing a photographic emulsion to the beam without compensation.
• The problem of two-sidedness can be solved by absorbing the light emerging from one side by an absorbing paint applied carefully not to damage the waveguide property of the guide.
• The invention also provides new possibilities for illuminating spatial light modulators (SLMs), such as diffracting out only polarized light and using the SLM to modulate the polarization.
</summary>

* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for testing rotors of dynamoelectric machines, such as electric motors and generators.
* The apparatus includes a test head for accepting and causing relative angular movement between the rotor and test head, and exciting means for magnetizing the rotor during such angular movement in response to an alternating current.
* The apparatus also includes voltage sensing means for generating a voltage signal responsive to the magnetic flux variations generated by the rotor in response to the magnetization by the exciting means, and current sensing means for sensing the magnitude of the alternating current utilized to magnetize the rotor and generating a current signal representative thereof.
* The apparatus further includes processing means for determining the resistance and reactance of the rotor responsive to the voltage signal and current signal, and for measuring the effective skew of the rotor and determining the effective electrical skew of the rotor responsive to the effective skew signal.

<summary>
* The present disclosure provides a method for securing a computing device by granting access to native resources of an operating system based on validated digital certificates associated with managed libraries.
* The method includes receiving a request from a managed application to access a native system resource through a managed library, authorizing the request based on a digital certificate associated with the managed library, and denying access to the native system resource if the digital certificate is not valid.
* The present disclosure also provides a method for protecting a closed mobile device from attackers by closing the device and segregating third-party code from kernel mode code.
* The method includes receiving a request from a managed application to access a native system resource, authorizing the request based on a digital certificate associated with the managed library, and denying access to the native system resource if the digital certificate is not valid.
* The present disclosure further provides a method for publishing videogames configured to execute on a mobile device, including validating digital certificates associated with the videogames and restricting access to the videogames based on the validated digital certificates.
</summary>

<summary>
     • The invention relates to a low-cost, easily constructed identification card with an antenna and chip incorporated into the body of the card.
     • The card contains two relatively shock-absorbing layers, which may contain indicia, and is surrounded by rigid outer layers to protect the electronic components from damage.
     • The invention differs from prior art cards in that normally rigid materials are used throughout the card, allowing external stresses and bending to damage the delicate IC chip and antenna.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a method for implementing a memory, particularly a functional memory, for a queue.
2. The invention provides a novel way of establishing a queue by means of a tree-shaped structure in which the nodes have a given maximum size.
3. Additions to the queue are directed to the first non-full node, seen from below, on the first edge of the data structure.
4. Deletions from the queue are directed to a leaf node on the edge of the tree.
5. The tree-shaped data structure is maintained in such a way that the leaf nodes remain at the same hierarchy level of the tree.
6. The node to be updated is easy to access, as the search proceeds by following the edge of the tree until a leaf node is found.
7. The updates are made faster and require less memory space than heretofore.
8. The tree need not be updated in connection with every addition or deletion.
9. The queue can be inverted in constant time and constant space irrespective of the length of the queue.
10. The invention is symmetrical, and the queue can be inverted by changing the value of an identifier indicating which way the queue is interpreted in each case.
</summary>

<summary>
     * The present invention relates to electrically programmable random access memory (EPROM) devices, and more particularly to embedded EPROM devices manufactured by existing integrated circuit (IC) technologies.
     * The invention provides practical methods to build embedded EPROM devices using existing IC manufacture technologies, and objectives to provide EPROM devices for DRAM redundancy circuits using existing DRAM technology and to provide EPROM devices manufactured by standard logic technologies that do not require high voltages for its operations.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a technique of easily and quickly determining the optimum value of feedback gain used for calculating correction amount in feedback control.
• The method of determining feedback gain according to the invention includes provisionally determining a predetermined value of a feedback gain, executing feedback control using the provisionally determined feedback gain, detecting an error between a designated value and an actual value of the subject of control during the execution of the second step, calculating an evaluation value indicative of the character of feedback control according to the error detected in the third step, executing the second to fourth steps repeatedly a plurality of times after provisionally determining a new feedback gain value different from the previous value, and calculating a feedback gain value which can provide for a suitable evaluation value according to the relation between the feedback gain value and the evaluation value obtained through the execution of the fifth step.
• The proportional gain is a factor which influences the stability of control, and the length of a curve obtained by plotting the error against time axis is suited for evaluating the proportional gain.
• The integral gain is a factor influencing the accuracy of control, and the integral of the error reflects the accuracy of control, and thus the integral of the absolute value of the error is suited for evaluating the integral gain.
• The differential gain is a factor influencing the response of control, and the integral of the absolute value of the error is suited for evaluating the differential gain.
• The present invention will be more fully understood from the following detailed description and appended claims when taken with the accompanying drawings.
• The method of determining feedback gain according to the invention can be applied to the running control of an automatic guidance vehicle (AGV) or the like.
• The invention provides a method of determining feedback gain which permits determining the proper value of feedback gain both easily and accurately, in a short period of time and irrespective of the kind of the subject of control.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to zoom lenses with increased relative aperture and good optical performance over the entire zooming range.
• The zoom lens comprises, from front to rear, a first lens unit of positive power for focusing, a second lens unit of negative power, a third lens unit of negative power for compensating for the shift of an image plane, a fourth lens unit of positive power for making the diverging light beam almost afocal, and a fifth lens unit having an image forming function.
• The invention satisfies certain conditions for the construction and arrangement of the elements of the fourth and fifth lens units to achieve good correction of aberrations and high grade optical performance throughout the entire zooming range.
• The invention is useful for photographic cameras and video cameras, particularly those with a 2/3 in. image pickup tube, and can reduce the physical size of the entire lens system while maintaining good optical performance.
</summary>

<summary>
    1. The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, photons or the like in a detector.
2. The method involves generating a charge pulse in the detector when a particle passes through and converting it into an electric signal, which is then amplified and/or integrated.
3. The invention aims to provide a method and device that can detect both individual particles and integrate count rates without knowing the expected count rates.
4. The method involves discharging the charge pulse or signal from the detector on the low-voltage side.
5. Both an amplification of individual signals in a fast amplifier and an integration of each of a plurality of signals in a slow amplifier are performed.
6. The invention proposes using a support capacitor to prevent interfering leakage current in a high-voltage cable.
7. The second, slow amplifier is provided for integrating signals upon exceeding a threshold value of the rate of the signals.
8. The invention also proposes using a material enabling fast charge transport at room temperature, such as diamond, as the detector material.
</summary>

• The invention relates to an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking a driven disc assembly.
• The apparatus includes an enclosure with a stationary ring mounted on an output shaft connected to a splined hub, upon which the driven disc assembly is mounted for rotation between two rings.
• The apparatus includes means for selectively moving the movable ring toward the stationary ring so as to frictionally engage the driven disc assembly therebetween.
• The distance separating the two rings is measured by an electronic sensor when the movable ring is moved toward the stationary ring.
• The torque motor is then energized to exert a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly, attempting to rotate it against the frictional force generated by the rings.
• Means are provided for sensing this rotation and for measuring the distance separating the two rings at that time.
• The difference between these two distances is compared with a standard value to determine if the driven disc assembly is excessively warped.
• The apparatus operates automatically without manual involvement by an operator.
• The apparatus generates an external indication to the operator of whether the driven disc assembly is good or bad.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to the field of image processing, particularly in face age-estimation and methods, systems, and software therefor.
• Face recognition is a challenging task due to various factors such as gender, ethnicity, heredity, and environmental factors.
• The effects of aging on the human face have been studied in numerous fields, including orthodontics, anthropology, anatomy, forensic art, and cognitive psychology.
• The present disclosure is directed to a method of generating a face age-estimation for a face represented by first image data as a function of faces represented by second image data and having assigned landmark points and known ages.
• The method includes receiving first image data, applying a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to generate a first feature vector, executing an age classifier on the first feature vector to identify an estimated age group for the face represented by the first image data, and applying an aging function to generate the face age-estimation as a function of the assigned landmark points of the second image data.
• In another embodiment, the present disclosure is directed to a method of face age-estimation, which includes extracting facial features from an image of a test subject and mapping the facial features to one of at least two differing age groups having corresponding differently calibrated mapping functions.
• The present invention is not limited to the precise arrangements and instrumentalities shown in the drawings, and various modifications and variations are possible.
• The present disclosure provides a method of generating a face age-estimation for a face represented by first image data as a function of faces represented by second image data and having assigned landmark points and known ages.
• The method includes receiving first image data, applying a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to generate a first feature vector, executing an age classifier on the first feature vector to identify an estimated age group for the face represented by the first image data, and applying an aging function to generate the face age-estimation as a function of the assigned landmark points of the second image data.
• The present disclosure also provides a machine-readable storage medium containing machine executable instructions for performing a method of face age-estimation, which includes extracting facial features from an image of a test subject and mapping the facial

<summary>
• The invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images.
• The device displays an image whose definition is determined by a plurality of pixels.
• The matrix display device includes at least one controller suitable for producing display light intensity signals for each of the pixels, and a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of a plurality of identical arrangements of a predetermined number of pixels.
• The first plurality of pixels of one of the arrangements are dedicated to display of a first image and receive the light intensity signals associated with the pixels of the first image that correspond thereto.
• One or more other pixels of the arrangement are dedicated to the display of a second image and receiving light intensity signals associated with the pixels of said second image that correspond thereto.
• The matrix display device produces the merged display of the first image and of the second image, the two images being, if necessary, redimensioned by scaling means.
</summary>

• The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for the purpose of activating a security system of a motor vehicle, particularly an access and/or ignition control system, having a housing in which electronics and a communication means are arranged.

• The identification data contained in the data unit can also be regenerated in known access control procedures.

• The problem addressed by the present invention is that of creating a mobile identification transmitter for a keyless activation of a security system of a motor vehicle which possesses an enlarged functionality and has a simple design, wherein the user is provided with a comfortable mobile identification transmitter.

• According to the invention, for this purpose a payment element is removably fastened in a receptacle of the housing, and a closure is separately arranged on the housing.

• The payment element can be removed from the housing by the user if necessary, and during the payment process, the payment element remains inside the housing.

<summary>
• The imaging device becomes inactive when not in use, and the tribo charge of the toner may decrease over time.
• The exemplary embodiments address this issue by determining the periods of inactivity and charging the toner to a predetermined level based on the determined period of inactivity.
• The exemplary embodiments may include an inactivity determining section that determines the periods of inactivity of the imaging device.
• The exemplary embodiments may also include a charging section that charges the toner to a predetermined level based on the determined period of inactivity.
• The charging section may measure the toner charge level when the printing machine is recovered from the inactivity and charge the toner to a predetermined level based on a difference between the measured charge of toner and a predetermined level.
• The exemplary embodiments may be included in a xerographic machine.
• The tribo charge of toner is returned to the level of normal operation after recovering from the inactivity.
• The intelligent method for controlling the tribo charge of toner overcomes problems in the related art developer.
• The imaging device may include a black and white printing machine, but the universal developer may be used in a multicolor printing machine as well.
• The developer housing holds toner and a developer, and the toner dispensed from the toner container and the developer dispensed from the developer container are mixed in the developer housing.
• The paddle wheel conveyor intermingles the fresh supply of toner particles with the carrier granules so as to form a new supply of developer material.
• The TC sensor monitors the concentration of the mixed toner and developer by detecting the tribo charge of the toner.
• The controller may increase the supply of the toner so as to adjust the concentration of the mixture to a predetermined amount.
• The exemplary embodiments may include a fuser assembly which permanently affixes the transfer toner powder images to the medium.
• The residual particles remaining on the photoreceptor belt after each copy are removed at a cleaning station for the next round of use.
• The intelligent toner charging system adjusts the tribo charge of toner based on the activity and in

• The present invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that can independently and precisely regulate the bias currents supplied to multiple magneto resistive heads mounted on a rotary drum.
• The invention provides a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that can switch over plural heads with high precision, particularly a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that can switch over multiple MR heads and recording heads mounted on a rotary drum at high speed.
• The invention also provides a recording/reproducing apparatus that can perform head switching at the desired timing, in particular a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that can switch over plural heads with high precision, including a recording/reproducing unit for recording/reproducing signals onto/from a recording medium with plural heads, a generating unit for generating control data for controlling the recording/reproducing unit, and a transmitting unit for transmitting control data generated by the generating unit to the recording/reproducing unit, wherein data for controlling the switching over among the plurality of heads are transmitted with priority over other control data.

<summary>
1. * The invention relates to a system and method for locating concealed objects, such as pipes or cables, in the presence of an adjacent object.
2. * The system uses a transmitter and receiver to induce alternating currents in the objects and sense magnetic fields associated with the currents.
3. * The invention improves the accuracy of tracing a buried cable in the presence of an adjacent cable by producing two distinct output signal nulls.
4. * The transmitter has a pair of antennae that are driven by RF signals and generate corresponding magnetic fields.
5. * The receiver senses the magnetic fields associated with the currents in the cables and produces an output signal dependent upon the presence of both currents.
6. * The invention can be used to locate and trace a buried cable in the presence of an adjacent cable by positioning the transmitter and receiver optimally and adjusting the receiver deadband control to shift the output signal characteristic upwardly or downwardly.
</summary>

• The invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a two-way speaker device with a telephone network.
• The apparatus includes a source of power for the interfacing apparatus, such as a transformer connected to a wall outlet in a home.
• Selective switch means are provided for selectively connecting the interfacing apparatus with the telephone network to permit telephone operation in either a conventional manner or in an automatic answering mode.
• The interfacer device includes an optocoupler for coupling the telephone ringing circuit in a manner which discharges a charging capacitor to a predetermined signal level.
• A timer is connected in circuit with the output of the optocoupler for limiting the time duration during which the telephone network is coupled to the speaker phone.

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a system for reducing or eliminating undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch ring network by replacing repeaters with remotely pumped optical amplifiers.
2. The invention utilizes a branch fiber optic cable to transmit optical energy at a wavelength other than signal wavelength to the remote optical amplifier.
3. The optical energy is used as a power source for an optical amplifier located in the branch fiber optic cable, the optical fiber cable trunk, or the branching unit.
4. Signal amplification is provided without the use of conventional optical repeaters.
5. A similar arrangement is also provided at the telecommunications hub, allowing optical energy at a wavelength other than signal wavelength to be coupled onto the optical fiber cable trunk and to be transported along the hub with any existing optical communications signals.
6. The hub assemblies are optically connected via a telecommunications cable trunk in a ring topology, with cable stations extracting and inserting trunk communication signals through branch fiber optic cables.
7. The present invention is not limited to undersea applications, but can also be applied to terrestrial communications systems.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices, which provides a quick and easy installation without visible fasteners.
* The device consists of a two-part construction, including an attachment member and a cover plate member, which are easily installed using available fasteners and do not require any visible fasteners when installed.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, which consists of as few parts as possible, is inexpensive to produce, operates reliably, and can easily be fitted to a monitor.
* The light-shielding device according to the invention consists of annular strips concentrically nested and essentially enclosing one another in a tight manner, which strips are suitable to be fixed in front of a displaying screen and in that case surround the screen, and can fold the light-shielding device around the displaying screen so that it is of very small size.
</summary>

* The present invention discloses a solution to automatically inform a speaker to decrease their speaking rate when it is likely too rapid for a listener to comprehend. (0007)
* The invention can be implemented in accordance with numerous aspects, including an automated method to facilitate understanding between discourse participants, a device for facilitating understanding between discourse participants, and a method for facilitating comprehension during a discourse. (0008-0010)
* The device can include a microphone, a sensory mechanism, a speaking rate processor, a language detector, a speech clarity processor, a comprehension comparator, a wireless transceiver, and the like. (0024-0026)
* The speaking rate processor can determine the speaking rate for speech obtained via the microphone, and the comprehension comparator can compare the speaking rate against a speaking rate threshold. (0025-0026)
* The invention can be implemented in a variety of ways, including as a program for controlling computing equipment, a program for enabling computing equipment to perform processes corresponding to the steps disclosed herein, and a service agent and/or machine manipulated by a service agent in response to a service request. (0014-0015)

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device for optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, which comprises means for deviating and suppressing the beam, in order to make the scanning beam run successively and cyclically over N lines of a picture plane on which the processes are optically projected.
* The device includes a cyclic line counter, which carries out one counting step for each line pulse and supplies an end-of-count pulse after p line pulses respectively, N/p being an integer >1, the end-of-count pulse being applied to the beam suppression circuit of the TV camera for picture beam suppression.
* The device is suitable for recording IR, UV or X-ray pictures, and can be used for analyzing rapid processes in a way that was not possible with conventional film cameras.
* The device can be used to record a picture consisting of 8 lines, with each line scanned in approximately 0.5 milliseconds, resulting in a picture repeat frequency of approximately 2000 sec -1.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to multimedia communications and provides a solution for integrating voice calls with multimedia sessions in a packet-based network.
• The invention provides a way to integrate multimedia capabilities with circuit-switched calls, and an exemplary embodiment uses a blended call approach where a single session includes both voice and multimedia components.
• The invention is designed to prolong the viability of existing network devices by allowing existing customer premises equipment and network elements to be used to support multimedia capabilities.
• The communication environment includes a communication network, clients, and customer premises equipment (CPE) associated with each client.
• The telephone type devices are directed to voice communications with limited data options, while the computer type devices have a monitor, keyboard, user input devices, and other conventional computer features.
• The invention may be used on any number of network systems using a number of different protocols, including a Session Initiation Protocol for Telephones (SIP) environment.
• The present invention is well suited for use with a Session Initiation Protocol for Telephones (SIP-T) configuration, and the information included in the SIP-T messages contains the information helpful in setting up and tearing down the parallel call components.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to electronic service delivery and specifically to content synchronization frameworks using dynamic attributes and file bundles for connected devices (<summary>

• Existing methods for data synchronization between a device and a server are generally carried out based on a predefined set of attributes (<summary>

• The present invention provides a central reference point for synchronization requests from connected client devices, and returns responses including file descriptions in a semantic compatible with the connected device (<summary>

• The present invention is highly scalable due to the client device performing a major portion of processing, and is deployable worldwide with support for multiple languages and character sets from a central reference point and distributed content servers (<summary>

<summary>
* The present invention provides systems and methods for facilitating communication between a finder of an object and an owner of the object.
* The invention allows a person, such as a finder of a lost or misplaced object, to anonymously communicate with another, such as the owner of the object.
* The systems and methods can be useful in facilitating the return of the object to its owner.
* An "owner," which can be an individual or entity wishing to protect portable personal property, is provided with specially prepared tags.
* The owner would then affix tags to any portable possession which she desires to be easily returned to her if lost or otherwise separated from her.
* With reference to  FIGS. 2A and 2B , such tags can be of any size or shape or type, such as a printed adhesive label or a plastic key-ring tag with a hole for a key ring or keychain.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to electron multipliers and their use in photomultipliers and particle detectors.
• The invention includes a foil electron multiplier that uses a series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure to multiply electrons.
• The foils are arranged in a sequential series of transmission stages, with each stage accelerating electrons through the foil using an electric field.
• The invention uses a discrete dynode or continuous electron multiplier design, with the foil electron multiplier falling within the latter category.
• The foil electron multiplier has a higher gain per multiplication stage than other types of electron multipliers, resulting in increased multiplication efficiency.
• The fabrication process for the foil electron multiplier is simpler than that of continuous electron multipliers, such as MCPs.
• The foil electron multiplier is more cost-effective than MCPs, as it requires fewer stages to obtain the same charge.
• The foil electron multiplier can cover a larger area than MCPs, making it more robust and less prone to breaking.
• The invention exhibits an intrinsic rejection of ion feedback at each stage, as ions generated at one foil cannot be re-transmitted back due to their low energy.
• The foil electron multiplier can be used in photomultiplier tubes and particle detectors, such as channel electron multipliers and microchannel plates.
• The invention can be used in various applications, including night vision devices, electron spectrometers, mass spectrometers, and photonic detectors.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a system that allows almost any motion picture to be viewed effortlessly by the viewer with the visual effect of 3-dimensions.
• The invention uses a computer algorithm running on a computer processor to calculate in real-time, and from a multiplicity of media frames, the synchronization and control events.
• The 3-dimensional visual effect is produced by the 3-D Phenomenoscope regardless of whether the motion picture was shot on regular or digital film; regardless of whether the presentation media is film, digital film, VCR tape, or DVD; and regardless of whether the motion picture is viewed in the movie theater, home TV, Cable TV, or on a PC monitor.
• The invention uses a pair of glasses with lenses that can rotate about a vertical axis to create stereoscopic effects.
• The invention teaches an opaque frame that can be placed in front of a user's eyes like a pair of glasses for 3-D viewing to take advantage of the Pulfrich effect.
• The frame has two rectangular apertures, preferably made of polyester film, and the surface of the strips facing away from the person's face is painted black.
• The invention uses signals to synchronize the lens filters to the lateral motion in the motion picture, and thus control the 3-dimensional visual effect for the viewer.
• The signals are developed in real-time by the 3-D Phenomenoscope, and does not require any alteration to the motion picture, or that any control information is placed in the motion picture.
• The invention can be used to view any motion picture with the visual effect of 3-dimensions, regardless of whether the motion picture was shot on regular or digital film, or how it is presented.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to an apparatus and method for the dicing of semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate the individual die from the wafer without the use of a wafer saw. * The method includes forming trenches along the scribe lines on a semiconductor wafer and then applying a mechanical pressure to the semiconductor wafer. * The mechanical pressure causes a "clean break" of the wafer along the scribe lines, thereby singulating individual die on the wafer.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a field emission display panel or device.
* The invention provides a novel protection structure for preventing burn-out damage to field emission elements in a field emission display device.
* The protection structure includes at least one reduction plate or electrode that deflects ionic emission gas away from the field emission components of the device.
* The invention is directed towards improving the field emission display devices, particularly those that use a cathode and an anode with a vacuum gap therebetween.
* The invention aims to provide a novel field emission display device that can operate at a lower voltage and with improved efficiency.
* The protection structure of the invention can be used in various types of field emission display devices, including those that use microtips or nanotube emitters as the electron emission sources.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to an image sensor, particularly a charge-coupled device (CCD) image sensor.
2. The image sensor includes multiple imaging planes, including a top surface and edges of the sensor.
3. The sensor includes an elongated substrate of a P-type material, with image sensor elements formed in the substrate.
4. The image sensor elements are arranged in columns along the edges of the sensor, with each element including an image sensing region and a charge collecting and transfer means.
5. The charge collecting and transfer means includes a buried-channel CCD, which is adapted to receive charge carriers generated by light impinging on the edges of the sensor.
6. The image sensor can be used to image in a plurality of planes, allowing it to be used in many image formats, such as imaging two opposing surfaces or the surface imaging of passageways.
7. The present invention can be formed using processing techniques compatible with those used in forming other types of image sensors, making it easy to incorporate the invention into various known image sensors.
8. The invention includes a P + layer between the image sensor elements and the sensor edges, which creates a waveguide-like structure and effectively guides charge carriers back toward the middle of the substrate.
9. The image sensor can be mounted on an insulated support block and interconnects can be used to make connections between bond wires and leads, allowing the sensor to be used in various applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to networks, particularly home networks employing devices with power management systems.
* A network master node performs network administrative functions and enters power save mode when not performing nominal device functions.
* A network slave node promotes itself to become the new network master node when the current network master node enters power save mode.
* The invention minimizes total power consumption while ensuring the best qualified network slave node is promoted to the network master role.
* The invention provides methods for transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device.
* The methods include receiving an instruction for a first device to enter power save mode and sending data from the first device to a second device enabling the second device to start performing network administrative functions.
* The first device enters power save mode after sending the data, and the second device becomes the new network master node.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to arrangements of antenna elements to measure the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation.
• The antenna array for operation by radio interferometric techniques comprises at least four antennae spaced so as to provide at least two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane.
• The array may operate in a receive mode or transmit mode, and the quotient signal is used to provide a measure of the elevation angle.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a subminiature lamp assembly that utilizes a high temperature polymer to directly surround and compress the glass envelope, providing extended axial length sealing, heat resistance, ease of handling, and increased resistance to invasion and chemical attack.
* The invention also provides a solution to combat the mechanisms of bulb degradation in conventional subminiature lamps, including high temperature, thermal expansion, moisture migration, and chemical attack, by using a polymeric material that is non-thermally conducting and able to withstand significant subminiature lamp temperature fluctuations.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) communications systems.
• The present invention relates to precoder configuration in MIMO systems.
• The known precoder configuration includes a block diagonalization (BD) technique and a tomlinson-harashima precoding (THP) scheme.
• The BD technique separates out the data streams to different user terminals (UTs) by ensuring that interference spans the null space of the victim UT's channel.
• The THP technique relies on successive interference pre-cancellation at the base station (BS).
• The invention proposes a new technique for realizing a generalized decision feedback equalizer (GDFE) based precoder in a base station of a multi-user MIMO wireless system.
• The new technique significantly reduces the computational cost while resulting in no capacity loss.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides a heat-dissipating device and a housing thereof, wherein an sidewall of the housing extends outwards to enlarge the intake airflow area without modifying the assembling conditions between the existing fan and other heat dissipation elements.
• The shape of the housing at the air outlet side is kept unchanged in order to enhance the heat-dissipating efficiency of the fan.
• The fan may be mounted to a system or other heat dissipation elements without changing the assembling conditions with the system and the heat dissipation elements.
• The sidewall of the passage extends radially outwardly with respect to a central axis of the passage in a symmetrical manner.
• The sidewall of the passage extends radially outwardly with respect to a longitudinal axis of the passage and beyond the peripheral edge of the outer frame.
• The sidewall of the passage extends radially outwardly with respect to a longitudinal axis of the passage in a frustum-conical or a frustum-elliptically conical manner.
• The sidewall of the passage is formed with an inclined portion or a beveled edge therearound.
• The housing includes an outer frame having a passage for guiding air streams to flow from an opening to another opening, wherein an sidewall of the passage at the air inlet side extends radially outwardly so as to enlarge the intake area of the air streams.
• The heat-dissipating device includes an impeller and a housing for receiving the impeller, wherein the housing includes a passage for guiding air streams to flow from an opening to another opening, and an sidewall of the passage at one of the openings extends radially outwardly with respect to a rotational axis of the heat-dissipating device so as to enlarge the intake/discharge area for the air streams.
• The heat-dissipating system includes a casing, at least one electrical element mounted within the casing, and a heat-dissipating device mounted on the casing for dissipating heat generated from the at least one electrical element when it operates, wherein the heat-dissipating device includes an impeller and a housing for receiving the impeller, and the housing includes an air inlet

<summary>
     * The electroluminescent display panel of the present invention is composed of various layers laminated on a glass substrate, including first and second electrodes, an insulation layer, a first luminescent layer, a second luminescent layer, and a second insulation layer.
     * The first luminescent layer is made of a material that emits light including no visible red light components, and the second luminescent layer is made of a material that emits light including visible red light components. The second luminescent layer partly overlaps the first luminescent layer, forming a single layer portion and a double layer portion.
</summary>

• The invention relates to an electronic portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, which establishes a wireless connection to a connecting unit that establishes a connection to a network and/or the Internet.
• The terminal provides telephony via a network or the Internet, which gives a considerable economic advantage, and the wireless connection is used to transfer data packets to the connecting unit in an expedient manner.

<summary>
1. The invention relates to a method for fabricating a structure useful in semiconductor circuitry.
2. The method involves growing a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide layer directly or indirectly on a semiconductor substrate.
3. A Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide is then deposited on the buffer layer.
4. The non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide is less than about 10 nm thick.
5. A second non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide layer may be grown on top of the Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide.
6. Both the high-dielectric constant oxides are ferroelectric oxides and/or titanates.
7. The non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide is barium strontium titanate, and the Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide is lead zirconate titanate.
8. Both the non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide and the Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide may be epitaxially grown.
9. A germanium layer may be epitaxially grown on the silicon substrate and the buffer layer may be grown on the germanium layer.
10. The structure may be used in semiconductor circuitry for capacitors, MOS transistors, pixels for light detecting arrays, and electrooptic applications.
</summary>

<summary>
     * The invention provides a receiver input circuit that enables substantial elimination of undesired signal actuation of non-linear components in the signal path, resulting in distortions, while taking into account adequate small signal behavior and using conventional components.
     * The circuit includes a control loop for amplification control, with the control signal for the control loop being derived from the intermediate frequency signal and supplied to the part of the circuit preceding the mixer stage, in addition to a second amplification control loop whose control signal is taken out prior to the mixer stage.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to network-implemented shared workspace environments and provides a method and apparatus for simple spontaneous setup of a shared workspace.
• The system is designed for use in a telephone call, where the parties involved have no technical background or training.
• The invention provides a collaboration button and an indicator on each party's telephone, which can be lit to indicate the presence of network collaboration capabilities.
• When one party activates the collaboration button, the system causes network-enabled applications to run on the individual users' desktop computers, allowing them to share information and conduct video conferences.
• The telephone is used in the usual way to make regular voice-only calls, and once the call is established, the parties can determine if they have the capability to share a document or conduct a video conference.
• If they do, the collaboration indicator is lit, and the parties can initiate collaboration using the collaboration application programs available to them.
• The invention provides a generalized architecture, where the LAN can include the Internet, and stations can be located anywhere geographically, as long as they have network access.
